name: Consolidation and expansion of 100% smokefree environments legislation, enactment and enforcement processes in Argentina
description: Strengthen and consolidate the enactment and effective enforcement of 100% smokefree environments legislation  at provincial and municipal levels in Argentina using a comprehensive strategy that includes advocacy, education and monitoring of tobacco policies in Argentina.

name: Strengthening Argentinian Tobacco Control
description: FIC Argentina will work with its existing coalition at the national and local levels to strengthen TAPS ban implementation and enforcement, advocate for subnational TAPS bans, enhance 100% smoke-free implementation, and support tobacco taxes increases.

name: Strengthening the Implementation of a Federal Tobacco Control Law in Argentina: 100% Smoke-Free Environments, Tobacco Advertising Ban and Warning Labels
description: This project aims to support and promote successful implementation and enforcement of the newly enacted national tobacco law nationwide, with particular focus on 100% smokefree environments, advertising ban and warning labels, and to increase the visibility and influence of Argentina Smokefree Alliance/ALIAR--expanding its capacity to other effectively address tobacco control issues such as advertising bans and warning labels.

name: Protecting Effective Tobacco Control Policies in Latin America and the Caribbean
description: To support coordinated responses among key organizations and advocates in targeted countries in Latin America aiming to promote and protect effective tobacco control policies across the region.

name: Strengthening the implementation of the national tobacco control law and promotion of a tobacco tax and price policy in Argentina.
description: FIC Argentina will continue its smoke-free work and its advertising, promotion, and sponsorship ban work, focusing on monitoring and compliance in each area with the help of its national coalition.  In addition, FIC Argentina will advocate for higher tobacco taxes.

name: Protecting effective tobacco control measures and de-normalizing tobacco industry interference in the Americas
description: To support coordinated responses amongst key organizations and advocates in targeted countries in the Latin America and Caribbean region, with the aim to promote and protect effective tobacco control policies across the region.

name: Exposing and discrediting the tobacco industry’s marketing strategies developed in Latin America to promote tobacco consumption
description: This project supports organizations in Argentina, Brazil, Colombia and Mexico to advocate for comprehensive, FCTC-compliant tobacco advertising, sponsorship, and promotion (TAPS) policies in the four countries and deflect measures to weaken passage and implementation of these policies.

name: Strengthening the enforcement of the national tobacco control law and increasing tobacco taxes.
description: FIC Argentina will work through its existing coalition at the national and local levels to stregthen TAPS ban implementation and enforcement, enhance smoke-free implementation and enforcement, and support increases in tobacco taxes.

name: Tobacco Industry and Decision Makers in Argentina: Campaign Contributions and Youth Prevention Programs
description: FIC Argentina will obtain and evaluate information regarding levels of transparency for funding of youth prevention programs and other related programs in Argentina.

name: Strengthening and sustaining the effective enforcement and comprehensive implementation of the smoke-free legislation in the city of Buenos Aires
org: Ministry of Health, Government of Buenos Aires
description: The aim of this project is to enhance implementation and strengthen effective enforcement of the 100% smoke free legislation for the city of Buenos Aires.  It will strengthen capacity (individual and institutional) to conduct surveillance of law compliance and develop a monitoring system for inspections.  The project will also work to foster compliance and sustainability by promoting public awareness of the importance of 100% smoke free environments with an emphasis on non- smokers’ rights.

name: Strengthening and sustaining the effective enforcement and comprehensive implementation of the smoke-free legislation in the city of Buenos Aires
org: Ministry of Health, Government of Buenos Aires
description: The aim of this project is to enhance implementation and strengthen effective enforcement of the 100% smoke free legislation for the city of Buenos Aires.  It will strengthen capacity (individual and institutional) to conduct surveillance of law compliance and develop a monitoring system for inspections.  The project will also work to foster compliance and sustainability by promoting public awareness of the importance of 100% smoke free environments with an emphasis on non- smokers’ rights.

name: Strengthening SFE legislation in Buenos Aires by including outdoor playgrounds and indoor waterpipe smoking ban.
org: Ministry of Health, Government of Buenos Aires
description: The main objective of this project is to amend the existing 100% smokefree legislation in Buenos Aires City in order to include prohibition of smoking around children playgrounds in outdoor public areas, and banning of indoor waterpipe smoking, and to set up the regulatory capacity for effective implementation.

name: 100% Smokefree Buenos Aires
org: Programme for Tobacco Prevention and Control, Ministry of Health, Government of the City of Buenos Aires
description: The project aims for Buenos Aires to become a 100% smokefree city. It will show that the current smokefree law does not protect health and it will build alliances to build support for 100% smokefree legislation. Legislative consensus will be obtained, and the current law will be amended and passed within two years of the project start date. An enforcement system will be set up to monitor compliance.

name: 100 % Smokefree Rosario: Efforts to Consolidate the Enforcement of the Legislation and Disseminate its Success in Argentina
org: Secretaria de Salud Publica de la Municipalidad de Rosario [Department of Public Health of the Municipality of Rosario]
description: To consolidate and improve the enforcement of 100% smokefree policy in the City of Rosario in Santa Fe, Argentina, strengthening collaboration between city government and the civil society of Rosario.

name: Enactment and Enforcement of 100% Tobacco Smokefree Policy at provincial and municipal levels in Argentina
description: To support the effective enforcement of the recently passed 100% smokefree provincial-municipal legislation in Tucumán, Santa Fe and Córdoba Provinces and cities of Bahia Blanca and Corrientes; to facilitate the enactment of strong laws in cities or provinces that are close to reaching this goal (Mendoza, Neuquen and Buenos Aires Provinces); and to strengthen capacity and networking among advocates through training, coaching and the creation of a National SmokeFree Environment Coalition.

name: Interventions to develop the national tobacco control strategy for Azerbaijan
org: Public Health and Reforms Centre, Ministry of Health of Azerbaijan Republic
description: The project aims to develop a national tobacco control strategy for Azerbaijan. It will: build national capacity in tobacco control by training 40 or more representatives of key stakeholders; facilitate the creation of a national tobacco control network, comprising governmental and non-governmental organisations (featuring a web platform and national workshop); develop and deliver a national tobacco control strategy to relevant government institutions.

name: Smoke Free Khulna Division through Effective Enforcement of Smoke free Provision of Tobacco Control Law
description: This project aims to make Khulna division smoke free under section 5 of the tobacco control act - 2005.  The project will replicate and expand upon the smoke free model used in 6 of the 10 districts to engage the remaining 4 districts of Khulna Division.  The project will raise awareness of the smoke free provision,  support the creation of smoke free public places and transport by motivating task force committee members and officials of Khulna City corporation, develop information and education materials to support 100% smoke free public places and transport, and  monitor, evaluate, document and disseminate the experiences of the project at different levels.

name: Strengthen Implementation of the Tobacco control law in Khulna Division
description: The project aims to strengthen implementation of the Tobacco Control Act 2005 and Regulation 2006, in particular creating smokefree public places and public transport, in Khulna Division. It will raise awareness of smokefree provisions among the public and stakeholders through collaborative efforts with local civil organisations. It will build capacity among stakeholders in order to ensure sustainability.

name: People’s Response On Tobacco law Enforcement through Campaign against Tobacco (PROTECT)
description: The aim of this project is to reduce tobacco consumption and exposure to second hand smoke in Khulna Division.  The project will involve local government authorities and taskforce committees in implementing the TC law and ensure smoke free educational facilities.  It will increase awareness about the law and the 2013 amendment as well as the health effects of tobacco use and second hand smoke.  The project will develop communications materials for smoke free public places.  Monitoring and evaluation will support the documentation of project progress and the dissemination of project experience.

name: Smoke-free Barisal Division Through Enforcing Tobacco Control Act and Raising Community Awareness
org: Alliance for Co-operation and Legal Aid Bangladesh (ACLAB)
description: The project aims to make Barisal smokefree by activating taskforces and law enforcers at district and sub-district levels to implement Tobacco Control Act 2005. It will sensitise and build capacity among NGOs, local government and other organisations, and will raise awareness among the public and stakeholders. The project will be sustainable and experiences will be shared with tobacco control organisations.

name: Smoke-free Barisal Division and 5 districts of Dhaka Division Through Enforcing Tobacco Control Act and Raising Community Awareness
org: Alliance for Co-operation and Legal Aid Bangladesh (ACLAB)
description: This project aims to expand smoke free areas so that Barisal Division and 5 Districts in Dhaka Division will be 100% smoke free by 2013.  The project will increase the number and involvement of local task-forces, increase public awareness, implement the 2005 Smoke Free Act in public places and public transport, strengthen coordination and linkages with NGOs and CBOs.  It will also strengthen linkages and coordination with media and with the government including the National Tobacco Control cell.

name: Implementation of Tobacco Control Law- Amended 2013 in Barisal & Dhaka Divisions through involvement of Local Government and other stakeholders.
org: Alliance for Co-operation and Legal Aid Bangladesh (ACLAB)
description: The aim of this project is to make raise awareness of the new and amended tobacco control law and to ensure smoke-free public places and public transportation in Barisal and Dhaka Divisions.

name: People’s Initiative to Tobacco Control in Rajshahi and Rangpur Division
description: The purpose of the project is to strengthen implementation of the newly amended tobacco control law in Rajshahi & Rangpur Division with a focus on ensuring 100% Smoke Free public places, enforcement of the bans on tobacco advertising, promotion and sponsorship, and of sale to and by minors. This will be done through combined effort of the 4 consortium partners who will independently lead initiatives to support implementation efforts in their own areas, as well as collectively build support for higher compliance to the laws in the North Western region of Bangladesh.

name: Strengthening  Tobacco Control in Rajshahi and Rangpur Division

name: People’s Initiative to Tobacco Control: Towards Smoke Free Rajshahi and Rangpur Division

name: People's Initiative to Tobacco Control: A Step towards Smoke Free Rajshahi Division
description: To promote 100% smoke-free environment in public places and public transportation in the Rajshahi Division of Bangladesh.

name: Promoting Tobacco Control Through Religious Leaders In Bangladesh: a pilot program in one Thana
description: The project aims to understand religious leaders' attitudes to smoking and smokefree polices and to establish coalition of religious organisations, providing training and capacity building for leaders. It will develop and test a model intervention for reducing tobacco use and exposure, and will assess its effectiveness.

name: Consortium to Strengthen Tobacco Control Law Regarding Packaging
description: To strengthen packaging and labeling laws by instituting pictorial warnings, strengthen existing warnings and address enforcement mechanisms by mobilizing civil society, media, NGO's and other stakeholders in the drive to modify existing tobacco control laws.

name: Advocacy for Comprehensive Implementation of TC Law in Dhaka City
description: The purpose of the project is to support effective implementation and enforcement of the newly amended tobacco control law in Dhaka city, with a focus on ensuring 100% Smoke Free public places, enforcement of the bans on tobacco advertising, promotion and sponsorship, and of sale to and by minors.

name: A Step Toward Smoke Free Dhaka City
description: The proposed project will take an important step in making Dhaka City 100% smoke-free, which will be the vision of the project while the current mission will be to achieve some realistic progress towards it.

name: Advocacy for comprehensive implementation of tobacco control law in Dhaka City
description: The purpose of the project is to protect nonsmokers living in Dhaka City from exposure to second hand smoke through the establishment of 100% smoke-free indoor environments in the city in light of the Framework Convention on Tobacco Control (FCTC), its guidelines and the tobacco control Law of Bangladesh.

name: "Advocacy with national level stakeholders to strengthen implementation of TAPS ban in Bangladesh through institutional directives and strategic litigations  "
description: The purpose of the project is to mobilize key stakeholders for development and issuance of necessary decisions/circulars/orders from relevant bodies to ensure effective implementation of TAPS ban mandated by the amended tobacco control law. Project seeks

name: Evidence based advocacy for effective tobacco taxation in Bangladesh.
description: The purpose of the project is to advocate for increased tobacco taxes on all tobacco products in such a way that effectively increase prices thereby reducing affordability and creating an impact on consumption. HDRC will generate and use evidence in support of its tax policy recommendations.

name: Implement the Tobacco Control Act-2005 to make smokefree public places and transport in five districts of Dhaka Division.
org: National Anti TB Association of Bangladesh
description: The project aims to implement the ‘Smoking and use of tobacco products (control) act 2005 and rules 2006, to create smokefree public places and public transport. It will: raise awareness among key stakeholders; build capacity among law enforcers, government administrators, NGOs and CBOs to collaborate and implement the law; monitor and evaluate the law; share experience and expertise with stakeholders.

name: Implement the Tobacco Control Act-2005 to make smoke free public places and transports in five districts of Dhaka Division
org: National Anti TB Association of Bangladesh (NATAB)
description: The aim of this project is to make public places and transports smoke free in a total of nine districts of Dhaka Division.  It builds upon the five districts from an earlier project by adding four new districts.

description: To strengthen and build capacity of the "United Forum Against Tobacco (UFAT)," a physicians’ network for tobacco control in Bangladesh," develop an action plan and mobilize the UFAT for policy advocacy towards effective tobacco control initiatives in Bangladesh.

name: United Forum against Tobacco-Mobilizing physicians in tobacco control policy advocacy in Bangladesh
description: The project seeks to mobilize the United Forum against Tobacco (UFAT) specifically its physicians in tobacco control policy advocacy in Bangladesh. The project will elevate the level of engagement and capacity of UFAT, and mobilize victims of tobacco along with their physicians to demand for effective tobacco control policies and their immediate implementation in Bangladesh.

name: Engaging physicians for tobacco control- formation of a platform  for a national policy on tobacco control  in Bangladesh
description: The purpose of this project is to engage physicians through a network of professional societies in a range of tobacco control interventions, including advocacy for effective implementation of the tobacco control law and adoption of a formal national tobacco control policy in Bangladesh

It will develop an action plan for strengthening the implementation of current tobacco control laws, including monitoring and coordination of activities.

name: Enforcement and amendment of National Tobacco Control Legislation in Bangladesh and full compliance with the FCTC.
org: National Tobacco Control Cell (NTCC), Ministry of Health and Family Welfare
description: The goal is to strengthen collaborative efforts and partnership with different ministries and civil society organizations for conforming tobacco control legislation with FCTC recommendations.

name: Enforcement and amendment of National Tobacco Control Legislation in Bangladesh full compliance with the FCTC
org: National Tobacco Control Cell (NTCC), Ministry of Health and Family Welfare
description: The aim of this project is to assure conformance of tobacco control legislation to FCTC recommendations.  The project will strengthen the National Tobacco Control Cell to lead tobacco control efforts in Bangladesh.  It will support tobacco control legislation consistent with FCTC recommendations.  It will also support implementation and enforcement the tobacco control law in Bangladesh.

name: Earned Media for Tobacco Control in Bangladesh through Enhanced Capacity of Journalists
description: To consolidate using the Anti-Tobacco Media Alliance the earned media environment and create an even stronger base of media support for important tobacco control policies, including a tobacco control law amendment and higher tobacco taxes.

name: Earned Media Advocacy to support Tobacco Control Policy initiatives in Bangladesh.
description: The overall purpose of the project is to further mobilize earned media to support ongoing tobacco control policy initiatives in Bangladesh.

name: Earned Media Advocacy to support Tobacco Control Policy initiatives in Bangladesh
description: The project aims at greater mobilization of earned media to support strategic policy advocacy goals of the tobacco control movement in Bangladesh through generating useful media coverage on issues related to tobacco control law implementation and tobacco taxation, and countering tobacco industry through strategic use of media to reduce its influence on tobacco control policies.  The project will tap into the media resource pool built and fostered during the past three and half years, and will implement project activities based on successes and lessons learned previously.

name: "Earned Media for Tobacco Control in Bangladesh Through Enhanced Capacity of Journalists
description: PROGGA

name: Earned media for tobacco control in Bangladesh through enhanced capacity of journalists
description: This project aims to mobilize earned media coverage to support and strengthen the implementation and enforcement of the amended tobacco control law and the rules in Bangladesh.

name: Earned Media on tobacco control in Bangladesh through enhanced capacity of journalists.
description: To earn increased media coverage on tobacco control issues in Bangladesh through facilitating enhanced capacity building of 140 Journalists and establishing a fellowship program on investigative journalism on tobacco control in Bangladesh. It also seeks to evoke healthy competition amongst journalists of both print and electronic media in the country by introducing tobacco control journalism awards.

name: Tobacco Free Sylhet
description: To develop and establish 100% smoke and tobacco free environments in Sylhet City Corporation, three district towns and 4 upazila towns (municipalities) of Sylhet Division, Bangladesh by 2012.

name: Supporting Effective Implementation and enforcement of Tobacco Control Laws in Sylhet Division.
description: The purpose of the project is to support relevant government authorities in establishing effective implementation and enforcement systems for the tobacco control law in the proposed working area of Sylhet Division, i.e. Sylhet City Corporation, three district towns (Hobigonj, Moulovibazer and Sunamgonj) and 4 upazila towns/municipalities (Zakigonj, Golapgonj, Balagonj and Madhabpur) by 2016.  The project will build on past successes of implementing the tobacco control law in the project areas during the last four years.

name: Protecting Women from Tobacco: Advocacy for Better Tobacco Control Policies and Law Amendment through the Anti-Tobacco Women's Alliance
description: The project aims to mobilize women to successfully advocate with Parliament in general- and with female Members of  Parliamentarians in particular- for an amendment to the national tobacco control legislation that contains comprehensive tobacco advertising bans and warning labels for smokeless tobacco products.

name: "Enabling Tabinaj for effective enforcement of TC law in relation to use of smokeless tobacco products and policy advocacy on supply side  "
description: This project aims to strengthen and mobilize Tamak Birodhi Nari Jote (TABINAJ), the first and only alliance of women against tobacco in the country, to advocate with relevant authorities for effective implementation and enforcement of the tobacco control law at the national and subnational level.

name: Supporting implementation and enforcement of TC law through the women's network (Tabinaj)
description: The project aims to strengthen and mobilize the Tamak Birodhi Nari Jote-Tabinaj (Anti-Tobacco Women’s Alliance), the first and only alliance of women against tobacco in the Bangladesh, to support and advocate for effective implementation and enforcement of the newly amended tobacco control law; advocate for revised cultivation policies and increase tobacco taxation.

name: Policy Advocacy for Effective Tax and Price measures on all tobacco products to curb tobacco use in Bangladesh
description: To advocate for more effective tobacco tax policies by conducting policy analysis and research on effective price measures, launching advocacy campaigns targeted towards policy makers and public health officials, lobbying key officials engaged in the adoption of increased tobacco taxes.

name: Policy Advocacy for Effective Tax and Price measures on all tobacco products to curb tobacco use in Bangladesh
description: To influence policy makers for more effective tax and price policy measures through necessary policy analysis and advocacy.

name: Strengthening Bangladeshi tobacco control through GO-NGO cooperation for improved FCTC implementation
description: This project aims to strengthen tobacco control in Bangladesh, emphasising FCTC implementation, correct weaknesses in the current law,and increase the role of NGOs in enforcement.

name: Strengthening Bangladeshi tobacco control through GO-NGO cooperation for improved FCTC implementation
description: The project aims to strengthen tobacco control in Bangladesh by: increasing local NGO capacity and networking; improving tobacco control law implementation and enforcement, especially at local level; working towards making the law compliant with FCTC provisions by October 2010. Other aims include maintaining high standards in media work and public information; strengthening partnerships and alliances; and conducting research, monitoring and evaluation.

name: Expanding grassroots efforts for stronger law implementation and amendment, 100% smoke-free and tax increase in Bangladesh
description: This project aims to strengthen implementation of tobacco control policies, specifically smoke free public places, ad bans, and graphic health warnings. It will accomplish this primarily through partnerships with NGOs for capacity building and community mobilization. Specific objectives are to increase effectiveness of NGOs in monitoring smoke free and ad ban implementation, increase the number of smoke free places, broaden and strengthen the campaign for law amendment and tax increase, and ensuring media coverage and support for these objectives.

name: Further broadening the tobacco control movement in Bangladesh: a focus on institutions
description: The aim of this project is to support government and agencies in the implementation and monitoring of the national tobacco control law.  It will promote support for amendments to strengthen the law, and for tax increases.  It will also explore linkages between non-communicable diseases, poverty and law.  The project will work to strengthen the capacity of network organizations. This includes establishing a resource centre at WBB for use by government, NGOs, journalists and others.

name: Strengthen collaboration among Government-NGO-CSOs to support tobacco control law amendment & regulations and implementation
description: The aim of this project is to strengthen and expand the existing network in tobacco control focusing on the national tobacco control law’s amendment and implementation, with special emphasis on smoke free policy.  As a resource centre for tobacco control, the project will provide technical advice and strengthen public support on the law amendment and related rules notification. It will continue fostering collaboration for effective implementation of the law.  The project will also support the government to incorporate tobacco control into NCD strategy.  The project will also work with government, NGOs and CSOs to implement policy on FCTC Article 5.3. to protect tobacco control policies from tobacco industry interference.

name: Strengthen a multi-sectoral approach into tobacco control in Bangladesh.
description: This project aims to create guidelines for the development of a sustainable funding mechanism for tobacco control and health promotion in Bangladesh using the new 1% health surcharge on tobacco products. It will engage multiple sectors and stakeholders in order to pass the guidelines, strengthen implementation of the tobacco control law and Article 5.3, and monitor tobacco industry activities.

name: Revising the Guangzhou tobacco control regulation and strengthening law enforcement to build 100% smoke-free environment
description: To support the adoption and implementation of a a sustainable funding mechanism policy; Monitor and promote successful FCTC Article 5.3 implementation; Further develop Bangladesh Anti-Tobacco Alliance (BATA) capacity.

name: Preparation of draft revised tobacco control law for Bangladesh
org: Work for a Better Bangladesh (WBB) Trust
description: To draft stronger tobacco control law ammendments, address weaknesses in the existing law, and ensure that Bangladesh meets the legal requirements under the FCTC in close collaboration with the National Tobacco Control Cell (NTCC) and relevant Ministries.

name: Promoting Smoke Free Local Government and Public Market Institutions in Chittagong Division
description: To promote smoke and tobacco free local government and public spaces within Chittagong Division in Bangladesh, by advocating for smoke free institutional policies and practices in Chittagong City Coorporation and 3 districts of Cox Bazaar, Comilla and Feni.

name: Promoting Smoke Free Local Government and Public Spaces in Chittagong Division
description: YPSA within the second phase of their smoke-free places project intends to replicate best practices in 4 working areas in 7 additional districts of Chittagong Divisions. The broad strategies of the project are to conduct advocacy with the local government through establishing smoke free civil society coalitions for institutional smoke free policies for local government and strengthen the enforcement and practice of the policies.

name: Promoting Smoke Free Local Government and Public Spaces in Chittagong Division
description: The project seeks to uphold the principles of FCTC in the tobacco control policy process in Bangladesh and institutionalize best practices of local government in establishing 100% smoke free environments across the country.

name: Promoting Smoke Free Local Government and Public Spaces in Bangladesh
description: The purpose of this project is to advocate for strengthen the implementation of the Tobacco Control Law and Rules-- by local administrations and law enforcing bodies-- and institutionalize the best practices for smoke-free implementation by local government bodies in Chittagong.

name: Strengthening Tobacco Control for a Tobacco-Free Bolivia
org: EMPODERATE BOLIVIA LIBRE DE TABACO WITH INTERAMERICAN HEART FOUNDATION
description: FIC Bolivia will build a coalition of governmental and non-governmental organizations that support a FCTC-compliant national tobacco control law.

org: PROGRESSIVE REINFORCEMENT OF ORGANIZATIONS AND INDIVIDUALS (PROI)
description: The project will support the Association "Progressive Reinforcement of Organizations and Individuals" (PROI)  to promote the adoption of FCTC compliant policies in the Federation of Bosnia and Herzegovina (FBiH) as well as partner with civil society organizations and the government in Republika Srpska (RS) to initiate adoption of similar policies in that region.

description: DESER will continue to collaborate with civil society, tobacco farmers, public health advocates and government leaders on the interface between tobacco cultivation and tobacco control policies in order to support the implementation of FCTC-compliant policies and laws that foster the health and economic well-being of family farmers.

name: Promoting Smoke Free Environments
description: The project aims to improve the Brazilian smoke free legislation and the national compliance of it by strengthening the language of smoke free Federal Law and establishing mechanisms to ensure compliance.

name: Improving smoke free legislation in Brazil
description: The aim of the project is to assure 100% smoke free public places by promoting  amendment of the current federal law in order to  eliminate designated smoking areas in enclosed places.

name: Empowering priority areas of the National Tobacco Control Policy in Brazil
org: Instituto Nacional de Câncer (National Cancer Institute)
description: Country: Brazil

name: Promoting sustainability of tobacco control policies and furthering FCTC implementation in Brazil
org: Instituto Nacional de Câncer (National Cancer Institute)
description: To promote tobacco control policy sustainability and further FCTC implementation in Brazil; establish a tax-based mechanism to fund TC activities; Support and monitor laws on tobacco plain-packaging and ban point of sale displays; and support implementation of national regulation to ban cigarette additives.

name: E-learning program to promote tobacco control activities for health inspectors in service throughout the Brazilian territory.
org: Oswaldo Cruz Foundation -- FIOCRUZ/ Executive Secretariat of the Open University of Brazil's National Health System
description: The aim of this project is to enable health inspectors to carry out monitoring and enforcement actions that contribute to the compliance of tobacco control interventions such as the ban on TAPS, SFE and tobacco product regulations.  The project will develop and provide a comprehensive training program for health inspectors responsible for the enforcement of tobacco control interventions in Brazil.

name: Protect and strengthen Tobacco Control Policies in Brazil
org: Oswaldo Cruz Foundation -- FIOCRUZ/ Executive Secretariat of the Open University of Brazil's National Health System
description: The overall purpose of the project is to protect and strengthen tobacco control policy infrastructure in Brazil by updating capacities for enforcing regulations and monitoring industry interference countrywide. It focuses on two major strategies: updating training of Brazilian health inspectors on tobacco control and monitoring tobacco industries strategies.

name: Bring Back the Ban: Civil society coalition for media advocacy and tobacco-free law enforcement in Bulgaria
description: The aim of this project is to reinstate the total legislative ban on tobacco smoking in closed public places Bulgaria and to foster public awareness and participation in enforcement of the law. Through personal and public communication strategies, and through coalition-building efforts, the project will restore political and public support for the reinstatement and effective implementation of the law.  Effective enforcement of the law will be strengthened by creating a mechanism for citizen engagement.  The project will also monitor the tobacco industry's efforts in order to limit interference with the law and its enforcement.

name: Strengthening tobacco control in Burkina Faso by developing a strategic plan and a law on tobacco control
description: The aim of the project is prepare a national strategic plan for tobacco control and based on it develop, validate and implement a comprehensive law on tobacco control.

name: Promotion and creation of smoke free spaces in Burkina Faso
org: Union des Associations de Lutte Contre le Tabac (UACT)
description: To strengthen existing smokefree policies and advertising bans; to launch advocacy campaigns targeted toward the Minister of Health, Director General, Minister of Territorial Administration and other government officials; to raise awareness of tobacco control in coordination with local authorities in the five administrative capitals of Burkina Faso; and to launch a media campaign including print, television and radio.

name: Advocacy to build a TC movement to accelerate the adoption of a national FCTC-compliant TC bill and advocate for tax increase nationally and regionally
description: The purpose of the project is to build a TC movement to accelerate the passage of a national TC law; prevent tobacco industry interference and advocate for tax increase nationally and strengthen regional tobacco control efforts.

name: Media Awareness and Advocacy Project in Cambodia
description: To build media awareness on tobacco control policies and the FCTC; to mobilize media agencies/organizations to prioritize tobacco control, to advocate for the ratification of the National Law on Tobacco Control and for FCTC compliance; to launch a media advocacy campaign on tobacco control, consisting of television, radio, newspapers, and magazines.

name: Advocacy for the Passage of Law on Tobacco Control
description: The project aims to speed up the process of passing the draft law on tobacco control and to implement the Framework Convention on Tobacco Control (FCTC).

name: Advocacy for Tobacco Control Policy Development and its Implementation
description: This project seeks to advocate for development of tobacco control regulations in line with FCTC, and to assist the Government of Cambodia in the implementation and enforcement of existing tobacco control regulations.

name: Advocacy for passage and enforcement of tobacco control policies in Cambodia

name: Effectively implementing the Law on Tobacco Control
description: The overall purpose of the project is to implement the Law on Tobacco Control in the most effective way by developing comprehensive regulations required by the law, advocating for effective mechanisms, and widely disseminating the law and regulations.

description: Country: Cambodia

name: Enacting regulations and establishing implementation mechanisms to effectively implement the new tobacco control legislation

description: This project aims to implement and enforce the Tobacco Control Law by creating necessary support legislation indicated in the Law. This grant will focus on implementation and enforcement of the sub-Decree on PHW. It will also focus on the formulation, implementation and enforcement of sub-decrees regarding TAPS, smokefree environments, policy inspection and monitoring, and licensing of tobacco products.

name: Legal Support for tobacco control policy development and its enactment in Cambodia.
description: The purpose of the project is to provide legal technical support for the development of tobacco control legislations and their enactment in Cambodia. SK & P Law group will work closely with the various government departments and with NGO Cambodia Movement

name: Campaign for the adoption of a FCTC compliant national tobacco control law in Cameroon
description: To support adoption of the Cameroonian National Tobacco Contril Bill and increase awareness of the FCTC among government officials, civil society organizations and the general public.

name: Campaign for the adoption of a FCTC compliant national tobacco control law in Cameroon
description: To support the adoption, enactment and the effective implementation of a FCTC-compliant TC law in Cameroon.

name: FCTC Implementation in francophone Africa
org: Association pour la defense de Droits des Consommateurs
description: The project aims to secure adoption and full enforcement of tobacco control legislation and/or regulations in line with FCTC COP guidelines and international best practice in Burkina Faso, Chad  and Niger, and to support FCTC ratification by Côte d’Ivoire. It aims to share experiences on FCTC implementation between francophone African countries, improve preparation for COP-4 and illicit trade protocol negotiations, and develop strategies for improving tobacco control resources.

name: Building civil society capacity to assist the government of Chad in implementing tobacco control policies
org: Association pour la defense des Droits des Consommateurs
description: The project aims to support the adoption of draft national tobacco control legislation, which is in line with the FCTC and includes smokefree public places, pictorial pack warnings and a total advertising ban. Investment will be made in lobbying, advocacy, and raising awareness and building support among the public.

name: Implementation FCTC and sharing best practices in francophone countries
org: Association pour la defense des Droits des Consommateurs
description: The aim of this project is to strengthen the capacity of five Francophone countries (Chad, Niger, Burkina, Guinea and Mauritania) to adopt and implement comprehensive legislation consistent with the Framework Convention on Tobacco Control.

name: Strengthening  implementation of FCTC in  Africa Francophone countries
org: Association pour la defense des Droits des Consommateurs
description: The aim of this project is to strengthen tobacco control capacity, policy and policy implementation in seven French-speaking African countries.  Through a combination of training, technical guidance, information sharing, strategic communications and monitoring the project will support capacity building of national tobacco control bodies, support implementation of smoking bans, health warnings, tax increases, FCTC implementation, and assist in countering tobacco industry interference.  Countries in which the project will provide support include Chad, Niger, Burkina, Cote D’Ivoire, Guinea, Mauritania, and Burundi.

name: Smokefree Chile
org: Department of Public Health, Ministry of Health
description: The aim of this project is to to ensure the modification and enhanced implementation of Chile´s national legislation to be consistent with FCTC requirements and recommendations, with a primary emphasis on 100% smoke-free public places and workplaces.

name: Strengthening implementation of FCTC in Chile
org: Department of Public Health, Ministry of Health
description: The aim of this project is to strengthen implementation of FCTC in Chile by introducing key improvements in the tobacco control legislation. The project seeks to implement a plain packaging policy and increase the size of pictorial warnings.  It will work to ban the display of cigarette packages and restrict retail displays in points of sale.  The project will provide the enforcement agency with full authority to impose appropriate sanctions and ensure that the inspections procedures are effective. Regional agencies responsible for the monitoring and inspection of tobacco control policies will be entitled to take actions and impose sanctions when violations occur.

name: Smoke-Free Chile: Building Policy Support for 100% Smoke-Free Environments
description: Systematic civil support to advance legislation supporting 100% smokefree environments in Chile.

name: Smoke-Free Chile: Building Legislative and Public Support for 100% Smoke-Free Environments

description: EPES will work closely with civil society, national and subnational government offices, and two local communities on the implementation and monitoring of Chile’s tobacco law as it relates to smoke-free environments and advertisement, promotion, and sponsorship.

name: Building Legislative and Citizen Support for Higher Taxes to Address Chile's Tobacco Epidemic
description: Fundación EPES will focus on tobacco taxation, smoke-free implementation, and tobacco advertising, sponsorship, and promotion ban implementation.

name: Civil society support actions for new tobacco control measures enacted in Chile: plain packaging and prohibition of additives
description: Fundación EPES will focus on supporting Chilean tobacco control initiatives.

name: Propaganda and training "Regulations of smoking control in Beijing".
org: Beijing Association for Smoking and Health
description: This project aims to promote the implementation of Regulations of Smoking Control in Beijing, effective on June 1, 2016, by improving the public awareness of tobacco harm, enhancing the compliance capacity of venue operators and strengthening the enforcement capacity of officials.

name: Protecting Children from Tobacco-Related Injury
org: Beijing Children's Legal Aid and Research Center
description: This project will build Beijing Children's Legal Aid as a professional Chinese tobacco free advocacy organization and support its legal professional network and other civil society stakeholders to promote tobacco control policy change.

name: Tobacco control program for public interest lawyers
description: The purpose of the project is to promote implementation of FCTC by monitoring implementation of tobacco control policies .

name: Tobacco control program for public interest lawyers
description: The purpose of the project is to promote and organize lawyers in the relevant fields to effectively participate in tobacco control policy development and actions.

name: Mass Media and Health Education Campaign supporting the Tobacco-Free Olympic Games and Cities
description: This project aims to inform and educate Olympic stakeholders and the public about the tobacco-free policy of the Games. It aims to raise awareness of the health effects of tobacco and support compliance.

description: To raise the media coverage of tobacco control within the general public of China, and to promote the implementation of the May 2009 decision on smoke-free healthcare facilities, through a series of media activities including media workshop, media works selection, newspaper columns, an online forums.

name: Tobacco Control Government Stakeholder Mapping & Price and Taxation Mechanisms
org: China Research Center for Public Policy
description: The project aims to map the tobacco industry landscape and identify the most effective tax and price mechanisms for reducing tobacco use in China.

description: This project aims to strengthen legal capacity for tobacco control in China by establishing a tobacco law clinic at one of China's leading law schools. The clinic will provide an outstanding group of graduate students with hands-on training in tobacco control law and effective participation in the legislative process for tobacco control.

name: Further Enhance the Tobacco Control Law Clinic of CUPL
org: China University of Political Science and Law
description: The project aims to strengthen legal capacity for tobacco control in China by further enhancing a law clinic at one of China's leading law schools. The clinic will provide top graduate students with tobacco control training and participation in the legislative process for tobacco control, as well as catalyze campaigns to make China's largest law school campus smoke-free.

name: To Promote the Tobacco Control Legislation
org: China University of Political Science and Law
description: This project aims to conduct evidence-based public health and administrative law research, draft laws, technical assistance and outreach to key government and party officials in China that results in FCTC-compliant legislation. This project also aims to mobilize law-making/policy-making departments, government officials, and legal professionals to support tobacco control related law-makings at both the central level and local level.

name: Tobacco Control Capacity Building for High Level Leading Cadres Studying in CAG to Promote Implementation of FCTC in China
description: This project aims to raise awareness of tobacco control among leading cadres at the ministerial level and department level in Chinese government; promote understanding of—and concrete support for- more comprehensive implementation of FCTC in China; and establish a model, smoke-free campus at the Chinese Academy of Governance.

name: Establishing 20 Smokefree Traditional Chinese Medicine (TCM) Hospitals
description: The project aims to protect the health of TCM staff, patients, and visitors from exposure to toabcco smoke and to increase the number of staff and patients quitting smoking

name: Accelerate incorporation of specific smokefree hospital requirements into TCM hospital management policy, promote 100% smokefree environment in all TCM hospitals
description: The aim of this project is to promote to the State Administration of Traditional Chinese Medicine to amend or issue (traditional Chinese medicine) TCM hospital management policy to be 100% smoke free in fulfilment of FCTC obligations.  CACM will provide information and technical support SATCM agencies in developing and implementing smoke free policies; strengthen the tobacco control capacity of TCM and CACM personnel; establish a CACM resource centre serving TCM hospitals and; magnify and highlight the tobacco control role of well-known TCM doctors.

name: Tobacco Control Advocacy
description: The purpose of this project is to use the social influence of celebrities to  advocate for the public to adopt healthy life styles--defined as not smoking-- and demand not to be exposed to secondhand smoke, in order to further increase government officials’ support for policies to promote tobacco control.

name: Overcoming obstacles to meaningful FCTC implementation mechanisms in China: exploring ways to address the conflict of interest in the current tobacco control mechanism and accelerate tobacco control
description: The project aims to advance tobacco control progress in China by exploring options to address the conflict of interest in the FCTC implementation mechanism and the role of STMA in tobacco control.

description: The project aims to promote the passage of FCTC-compliant national smoke-free policy and law that bans TAPS in China, carry out successful advocacy on behalf of tobacco control, and develop supporters for the policies at the national level as well as the local level.

name: Promoting the passage of FCTC-complaint national smoke-free policy and TAPS bans

It aims to create 100% smokefree environments in 7-10 selected provincial cities. It will increase public awareness of the need for smokefree laws via mass media campaigns. The national, provincial and city tobacco control networks will be strengthened.

name: To increase the rate of smoke-free environments in Olympic/ Para-Olympic cities in mainland China
org: Chinese Center For Disease Control and Prevention
description: This project aims to improve and implement smokefree policies in Olympic cities, to increase public awareness of the health effects of tobacco, to change behaviour among continuing smokers, to increase quit rates and to ensure that all Olympic venues are 100% smokefree.

name: Strengthen the capacity building of the National Office of Tobacco Control in China CDC
org: Chinese Center For Disease Control and Prevention
description: The aim of this project is to strengthen the China CDC National Tobacco Control Office and support its efforts to promote the creation of 100% smoke free environments and move towards a smoke free China.  The project will promote national and local tobacco control legislation, including 100% smoke free environments in project cities.  It will also utilize media campaigns to increase public perception of the harmfulness of tobacco smoke and change perceptions regarding use of cigarettes as a gift and social courtesy.  Best practice evaluation methods will assess the impact of tobacco control legislation.

name: Media Communication for Smoke-free Cities

The project will strengthen capacity building of the China CDC Tobacco Control Office, promote smokefree legislation and enforcement and the creation of 100% smoke-free environments.  It will utilize media communication and social mobilization  The project will assess the impact of tobacco control interventions by developing and applying best-practice evaluation methods.

name: Promoting 100% smokefree legislation and 100% smokefree indoor environments in Tianjin, China (Phase III)
org: Chinese Center For Disease Control and Prevention
description: Through coordination and provision of technical assistance China CDC Tobacco Control office shall support six Chinese municipalities/provincial capitals/special administrative municipalities to carry out tobacco control activities. In each individual city, the project shall strengthen the capacity of local implementation institution in tobacco control and move towards a 100% smoke free environment while supporting and building towards other measures required under WHO-FCTC.

name: Promoting 100% Smokefree Legislation and 100% Smokefree Indoor Environments in Lanzhou, P.R. China (Phase III)
org: Chinese Center For Disease Control and Prevention
description: This project aims to strengthen implementation of the Lanzhou Public Places Tobacco Control Regulations and minimize exposure to second-hand smoke in public places. It will build capacity of local tobacco control institutions, develop the tobacco control network and promote the creation of 100% smoke-free environments in public and work places.

name: Promoting 100% smokefree legislation and 100% smokefree indoor environments in Shenzhen, China (Phase III)
org: Chinese Center For Disease Control and Prevention
description: The aim of this project is to facilitate the implementation and enforcement of the local smokefree law, creating a city-wide 100% smokefree environment. The project will strengthen capacity of the tobacco control network and enforcement agencies, create public awareness of smoking and second-hand smoke harm and evaluate the impact of tobacco control interventions.

name: Promoting 100% Smokefree Legislation and 100% Smokefree Indoor Environments in Harbin, P.R. China (Phase III)
org: Chinese Center For Disease Control and Prevention
description: This project aims to improve implementation of the Regulations for Preventing Harm of Second-Hand Smoke of Harbin City and create 100% smoke-free environments. It will strengthen the capacity of the various government agencies involved in implementation and raise public awareness of the law through media campaigns.

name: Media Communication for Smoke-free Cities
