name: Smoke Free Himachal Pradesh (HP) Through Effective Implementation of Cigarettes and Other Tobacco Products Act (COTPA)
description: The project will focus on effective implementation of various elements of the COTPA, with special emphasis on Sections 4 and 8 (Smoke Free and Sales to Minors) in partnership with state/district tobacco control cell and steering committees.  The project aims to create a micro-level, model strategy of Public-Private Partnership for the effective implementation and enforcement of this legislation.  Key strategies include stakeholder empowerment for enforcement, community mobilization, coalition development, media advocacy, and policy focused strategic research, monitoring and evaluation.

name: Awareness to action through multi-channel advocacy for effective tobacco control in India: capacity building in five Indian states
description: The project aims to strengthen and augment tobacco control advocacy in five Indian states, and improve the national tobacco control law and government-NGO partnership. It will: build capacity for state and district level enforcement of existing laws; advocate for strengthening the national tobacco control law; provide legal assistance for effective implementation; expand the AFTC network; develop resources for stakeholders.

name: Te develop, design and implement a rigorous media advocacy campaign for promoting pictorial health warnings on tobacco product packages in India
description: To develop, design and implement a rigorous media advocacy campaign for promoting pictorial health warnings on tobacco product packages in India by mobilizing the public, media, opinion makers and policymakers to support the inclusion of pictorial health warnings on tobacco product packages, and effectively counter the concerns raised by the tobacco industry with respect to pictorial warnings.

name: Advancing Tobacco Control in India Through Capacity Building, Evidence Based Policy Development, Legislation, Enforcement and Advocacy facilitated by AFTC (Delhi)
description: This project aims to initiate and coordinate tobacco control advocacy to promote enforcement of enactive law and notified rules at national and state level. It aims to advocate bringing Indian law into line with the FCTC, to expand the NGO network, and build capacity among stakeholders.

name: Intensifying Multi-Sectoral Efforts for Effective Enforcement of Tobacco Control Measures in Two Indian States
description: The aim of this project is to intensify on-going efforts in two, targeted Indian states for implementation of Control of Tobacco and Other Products Act (COTPA).  The project will focus on development and implementation of effective and sustainable enforcement mechanisms for Sections 4 (smoke free public places) and 6 (sales to minors) at state, district and sub-district levels.

name: To garner support for strengthening COTPA amendment Bill, and advocating for implementation of 85% Pictorial Health Warnings on all tobacco products.
description: The purpose of the project is to garner support for strengthening COTPA amendment Bill, and to advocate for implementation of 85% Pictorial Health Warnings on all tobacco products. The project will seek to devise strategic and evidence based response against tobacco industry’s opposition to the proposed Bill and notification of its implementation.

name: Mobilizing Youth Action to Monitor Tobacco Industry Marketing Tactics in India
description: This project aims to empower young health advocates to monitor and counter tobacco industry marketing around schools in New Delhi.

name: Multi-stakeholder Advocacy on Pictorial Health Warnings (PHWs) in India
description: This project aims to garner support for immediate implementation of 85% of PHWs on both sides of tobacco packaging in India. This project will highlight the urgency of implementing larger PHWs through the engagement of youth and health professionals.

name: Garnering support from vernacular and local media to increase reporting on tobacco control in grassroots press and media in North, western and northeastern states (January - December 2010)
description: The project seeks to strengthen reporting and coverage of tobacco control issues in all vernacular press in India, and localise the context of tobacco control by creating awareness at district and state level; and creating local 'champion' journalists/ reporters on tobacco control issues.

name: Countering the Government Sponsored Global Tobacco Trade Event in India
description: A global tobacco industry trade event under the banner of the 'Global Tobacco Networking Forum 2010 (GTNF)' has been proposed to be held during the October 4-8 2010 at Bangalore city in India and initially suported by the Indian Tobacco Board.

name: Total Tobacco Control - Karnataka
description: The project aims to reduce prevalence of tobacco use in the state of Karnataka by 5% annually through effectively engaging state leadership, building ownership, and assisting the state administration to institute and implement comprehensive and integrated tobacco control policies.

name: Comprehensive Tobacco Control in Karnataka
description: The overall purpose of the project is to support implementation of comprehensive and integrated tobacco control policies in the state of Karnataka by engaging the state and district leadership and getting the state government’s commitment to tobacco control.

name: Comprehensive Tobacco Control Karnataka
description: The purpose of this project is to support implementation of comprehensive tobacco control policies in the state of Karnataka through policy and media advocacy.

name: A partnership to make Thiruvanathapuram and Cochin the first smokefree tourist destinations in India
description: The project aims to make the Thiruvanathapuram and Ernakulam districts of Kerala 100% smokefree by implementing the national tobacco control law. It will: build a supportive environment for implementation of the law; build stakeholder capacity for implementation and enforcement; support effective enforcement; build effective stakeholder partnerships; develop locally relevant media and public education campaigns; undertake research, monitoring and evaluation.

name: A partnership Effort to Make Thiruvanathapuram & Cochin become the first smoke free tourist destination in India
description: The aim of this project is to create 100% smoke free districts in Kerala State.  It will encourage institutionalization of tobacco control in the state by supporting state and district nodal officers as well as establishing a functional steering committee at the state and district levels.  The project will sensitize state government and political leadership about the need for advanced policies for tobacco control and concurrently strengthen and empower civil society through technical and resource support for monitoring, media campaigns and community mobilization.

name: Advancing comprehensive tobacco control in Kerala through capacity building and enforcement of COTPA (2013-2014)
description: The aim of this project is to develop, strengthen and sustain infrastructure and support transfer of tobacco control to local administration and civil society partners.

name: Sustaining tobacco control in Kerala through monitoring and enforcement of tobacco control laws (2014-2015)
description: The aim of this project is to ensure implementation of the Cigarettes and Other Products Act, 2003, its rules and notifications, WHO MPOWER and FCTC.  The project will advance and strengthen efforts towards a comprehensive ban on TAPS and ensure compliance of new pack warnings on all tobacco products.  It will strengthen state and district level institutional mechanisms for compliance and enforcement to sustain gains made in smokefree and reducing minor’s access to tobacco products.  The project will support the state government to develop a state-level policy to protect policymakers and enforcers from tobacco industry interference.

name: Tobacco Control Litigation Project
description: To undertake litigation activities to support effective tobacco control in India ,file legal cases systematically and strategically to support tobacco control, to ensure India's compliance with the Framework Convention on Tobacco Control FCTC), and provide legal support to NGOs and/or the Government of India on issues concerning tobacco control and India's implementation implementation of the FCTC.

name: Enforcement of Tobacco Laws and making public places smoke free in eight districts of Indore division of Madhya Pradesh
description: The project aims to assure implementation of the COTPA (Control of Tobacco and Other Tobacco Products Act) by making public places, workplaces and transport smoke free in eight districts.  It also aims to mainstream tobacco control into the public health system.

name: Comprehensive and Synchronized Approach for Tobacco Control in 13 Districts of Indore and Bhopal Divisions of Madhya Pradesh
description: The aim of this project is to ensure effective implementation of sections 4 and 6 of the Cigarettes and Other Tobacco Products Act (COTPA) pertaining to smoke free places and prohibiting sales to minors.  The project will focus on rural and urban areas in 11 divisions of Bhopal and Ujjain – a combined total population of over 10 million.  The project will use strategies such as mapping, capacity building, community mobilization and policy focused research and monitoring and evaluation.  The intention is to develop a supportive environment and effective and sustained mechanisms for implementation and enforcement of the law.

name: Integrated intervention for institutionalization and enforcement of COTPA for tobacco control in Sagar and Narmadapuram divisions of Madhya Pradesh.
description: Project aims to ensure institutionalization and enforcement of section 4, 5, 6, and 7 of COTPA focusing on smoke free, prohibition of TAPS, protection of minors and ensuring display of mandatory pack warnings respectively in 8 districts of Sagar and Narmadapuram divisions. The project also aims to sustain the process in 11 districts of Ujjain and Bhopal divisions under the current project.

name: Advancing Tobacco Control in State of West Bengal through System Establishment, Capacity Building and Comprehensive Enforcement of Legislation
description: The aim of this project is to  strengthen the mechanisms for enforcing Cigarettes and Other Tobacco Products (Prohibition of Advertisement and Regulation of Trade and Commerce, Production, Supply and Distribution) Act (COTPA), 2003 and its revised Gazette notifications and rules.  The project will establish and institutional mechanism for tobacco control established in all 20 districts of the State.  It will also ensure that five districts (Kolkata, Howrah, Bankura, Paschim Medinipur, and Purulia) become fully compliant to all provisions (Section 4,5,6 and 7,8&9) of COTPA, 2003.

name: To provide support to mobilize mass support and exerting pressure on the Indian Government to bring out pictorial warnings on the packages of all tobacco products in India.
description: To mobilize mass support and exert pressure on Indian Government to bring out pictorial warnings on tobacco products in India, lobby with the legislators to mobilize their support and pressurize the central Government to implement the pictorial warnings on all packages of the tobacco products.

name: Discrediting  Tobacco Industry Efforts through Children Against Tobacco (CAT) in Tamil Nadu
description: This project aims to empower young health advocates to monitor and counter tobacco industry marketing around schools in Tamil Nadu.

name: Stopping Tobacco Industry’s Interference through effective implementation of WHO FCTC Article 5.3 in Tamil Nadu, India
description: The aim of this project is to  stop tobacco industry’s interference in the Governmental and health policies of the State of Tamil Nadu through the effective implementation of the WHO FCTC Article 5.3.  The project will increase the level of awareness among policy makers and key stakeholders about tobacco industry interference and the need for a policy in line with Article 5.3 of FCTC for the state of Tamil Nadu.  It will develop, draft and ensure adoption of a policy for the state of Tamil Nadu that would conform and or exceed with the provisions of Article 5.3.  The project wlll also ensure effective implementation of the state policy through active participation of civil society and other stakeholders

name: Advocacy workshops for sensitizing various stakeholders in India at national and state level on tobacco control laws and measures
description: This project aims to run sensitisation and awareness workshops for senior policy makers, law enforcers, and civil society groups at national level, and for key staff at regional level. National and state-level enforcement action plans for implementation of Indian tobacco control laws and FCTC provisions will be prepared.

name: National Media Fellowship Program
description: To create the National Media Fellowship Programme.  The fellowships support the pursuit of in-depth, creative field research on these concerns and writing about them with adequate evidence – qualitative and quantitative – to impact the public policy and the domain of social consciousness.

name: Smoke-free Chennai: Towards achieving 100% Smoke-free environments
description: The project aims to persuade the Chennai local government to implement comprehensive smokefree legislation. It will encourage the authorities, the health department, and the police to promote smokefree places, and stakeholders such as managers of businesses and public offices to declare their workplaces smokefree. Sustained media campaigns will be used.

name: Out of sight Out of mind-Ensuring Effective Implementation of ban on point of Sale advertisements in Chennai City.
description: To ensure effective implementation of the ban on advertisement of cigarette and other tobacco products in Chennai in an effort to reduce tobacco consumption and promote public health.

name: Combating Tobacco Advertising, Promotion and Sponsorship (TAPS) Tactics in the State of Tamil Nadu, India
description: The overall goal of the project is to work towards tobacco advertisement free Tamil Nadu. The project also seeks to build capacity at the state government level for implementation and enforcement of the provisions of COTPA towards ensuring TAPS free Tamil Nadu.

name: From Tobacco Control Law to effective enforcement -- Advocacy and technical assistance for innovative solutions, co-created and collaboratively delivered.
description: The aim of this project is to reduce exposure to second hand smoke and to reduce tobacco use by building capacity to effectively enforce sections 4, 5, 6, and 7 of the Cigarettes and Other Tobacco Products Act (COTPA).  The project will create civil society coalitions to increase involvement in tobacco control efforts at district level, support the appointment of district nodal officers and constitution of steering committees and support the development of work plans.  It will also enhance operational capacities of state and district level National Tobacco Control Program staff.

name: From Tobacco Control Law to effective enforcement – technical assistance for innovative solutions, co-created and collaboratively delivered Phase II
description: The aim of this project is to effectively enforce universal compliance with the Cigarettes and Other Tobacco Products Act, 2003 (COTPA) Sections 4, 5, 6 and 7 across eleven districts in Rajasthan.

name: Communicating with Parliamentarians to advocate for effective tobacco control measures in India
description: To engage and interact with parliamentarians and the media on tobacco control policy issues to create awareness on tobacco control issues and promote effective tobacco control measures in India.

name: Establishment of Tobacco Control Mechanism in Rajasthan.
description: The overall purpose of the project is to bring a reduction in the prevalence of tobacco use in the state of Rajasthan by 5% per year. The project aims to do so by effectively engaging the state leadership, building ownership, and getting the state administration committed to instituting and implementing comprehensive and integrated tobacco control measures.

name: Complete Action for End Game of Tobacco in Rajasthan
description: This project aims to strengthen the implementation of comprehensive tobacco control policies within the state of Rajasthan through engagement of the state and divisional administration, advocating for government commitment to tobacco control, media interventions and technical support among relevant authorities.

name: Campaign to discredit the tobacco industry’s marketing tactics to lure youth
description: This project aims to empower young health advocates to monitor and counter tobacco industry marketing around schools in Mumbai.

name: To provide funds to SBF for SBF to deliver immediately to HSI to support a new campaign run by HSI to counter the tobacco industry’s claims against policies mandating health warnings on tobacco products
description: To launch a campaign to counter tobacco industries’ claims against policies mandating health warnings on tobacco products, and assuring the public that these policies are just, and positive contributions to the public health and well being.

name: To provide support for Protecting Pictorial warnings on all tobacco products in India.
description: To prevent further delay and dilution of the Indian pictorial pack warning label law by raise awareness among key government officials and persuading Indian courts to reject the health ministry’s request for a delay or tobacco industry’s request for a stay order through raising support in key cities

name: Advancing comprehensive tobacco control in Rajasthan through Advocacy, Public Education, Capacity Building, Enforcement of Legislation, and Monitoring and Evaluation
description: The aim of this project is to ensure effective implementation of sections 4, 5, 6 and 7 of the Cigarettes and Other Tobacco Products Act (COTPA) in 24 out of 33 districts of Rajasthan, India.  The project will establish a political, administrative and institutional frame work for implementation of tobacco control in the states of Rajasthan and Karnataka.  It will build capacity for effective implementation of tobacco control policies, establish and implement an enforcement mechanism for COTPA and generate public awareness through information, education, and media.  It will also create effective coalitions and conduct monitoring and evaluation.

name: Advancing comprehensive tobacco control to make Rajasthan a MPOWER Compliance model state in India
description: The project aims to effectively implement the MPOWER policy package in the state of Rajasthan by developing an effective monitoring mechanism to ensure implementation of tobacco control laws, creating and strengthening a political administrative framework, building capacity of stakeholders, establishing a legal mechanism to coordinate FCTC article 5.3, coalition building & networking, public awareness and strategic monitoring and evaluation.

name: Advancing Tobacco Control with special emphasis on enforcement of Indian Tobacco Control Legislations (COTPA 2003) in the Indian state of Bihar
org: Socio  Economic and Educational Development Society (SEEDS)
description: The aim of this project is to strengthen enforcement of the Cigarette and Other Tobacco Products Act (COTPA-2003) in all districts of Bihar.  The project seeks to institutionalize the tobacco control initiatives at district and sub-district levels and will build capacity of law enforcing agencies from key departments and stakeholders at district and sub-district levels.  It will establish and implement an enforcement mechanism for COTPA -2003, generate public awareness through effective use of Information, Education, Communication (IEC) and media.  It will also conduct strategic policy focused research, monitoring and evaluation.

name: Advancing tobacco control policy in the Indian state of Bihar
org: Socio Economic and Educational Development Society (SEEDS)
description: The purpose of the project is to strengthen and augment enforcement of COTPA in all 38 districts of Bihar. It aims to ensure compliance with COTPA (section 4, 5, 6 and 7) through extending technical support and building capacity of all stakeholders at divisional, district and sub-district levels.

name: Effective Implementation of Tobacco control laws in Karnataka by Capacity Building and Monitoring
org: State Anti Tobacco Cell - Karnataka State Health & Family Welfare Society
description: Country: India

name: Effective Implementation of Tobacco Control laws in Karnataka by Capacity Building, Enforcement and Monitoring – Phase 2.
org: State Anti Tobacco Cell - Karnataka State Health & Family Welfare Society
description: To strengthen the implementation, enforcement and monitoring of tobacco control laws in Karnataka; To build capacity of stakeholders and strengthen the KCTC alliance with improved partnership. To generate awareness through media advocacy.

name: Smokefree Ahmedabad and Gandhinagar Districts
org: State Tobacco Control Cell, Government of Gujarat
description: The project aims to create smokefree Ahmedabad and Gandhinagar districts by implementing and enforcing existing Tobacco Control Acts. It will: provide continuity of leadership; strengthen the capacity of law enforcers; mobilise opinion leaders and decision makers; use media communication to raise public awareness, generate support for enforcement, and counter tobacco industry tactics; build alliances; undertake strategic research, monitoring and evaluation.

name: Gujarat Tobacco Control Programme
org: State Tobacco Control Cell, Government of Gujarat
description: The aim of this project is to ensure expansion of a comprehensive tobacco control program in four districts of Gujarat state. The project will create an institutional framework for enforcement of the existing tobacco control law in collaboration with local government departments and partnerships with civil society organizations. The project will build enforcement capacity among key government stakeholders, and also work to strengthen tobacco control laws in the four districts (Sabarkantha, Vadodara, Baruch and Patan). The project will establish an effective monitoring and evaluation framework to document progress.

name: Support the National Tobacco Control Programme and to strengthen the COPTA implementation in selected jurisdictions in 2011-2012
description: The aim of this project is to support the India National Tobacco Control Program in its pilot phase through targeted technical support to 20 selected districts (representing 50% of pilot phase districts).  In coordination with partners, the Union South-East Asia Office will work with NTCP at sub-national levels to develop operational and technical guidelines which will inform development of a similar framework at the national level.  It will also expand and strengthen implementation of Articles 4, 6 & 7 of the Control of Tobacco Products Act (COTPA) which address smoke free public places; ban on tobacco advertising, sponsorship and promotion; and ban on sales to minors and sale of tobacco products around educational institutions respectively.

name: Smokefree policy implementation in Ranchi and Shimla cities in India
description: Country: India

name: Supporting the expansion of National Tobacco Control Programme and strengthening COTPA implementation in selected jurisdictions in India.
description: Country: India

name: Support grant to supplement India 12-43 and India OC-404 in 2013-2015
description: Country: India

name: Strengthening, Implementation, Enforcement & Capacity building of Government, local administration and civil society to advance tobacco control in Uttar Pradesh
description: The aim of this project is to ensure effective implementation and enforcement of the Control of Tobacco and Other Products Act (COTPA 2003) in the state of Uttar Pradesh.  The project will establish political and administrative commitment and an institutional framework for implementation of tobacco control.  It will build capacity for effective implementation of tobacco control interventions and programmes and establish an enforcement mechanism for COTPA implementation.

name: Political Advocacy, Media Advocacy and Building Capacities for Issue-Based Campaign for Tobacco Control in Assam and the NE States
description: The project will focus on high level political advocacy and sustained media advocacy in Assam, Arunachal Pradesh, and Manipur to initiate, advance and sustain tobacco control efforts in the North Eastern states of India.

name: Strengthening and Sustaining Tobacco Control through Policy and Media Advocacy
description: This project will focus on high level policy advocacy and media advocacy to strengthen tobacco control policy and implementation in the state of Assam through an inter-sectorial and coordinated approach.

name: VHAI Advocacy and Campaign Unit for Tobacco Control
description: The project will focus on seeking high-level policy and political support for effective implementation of tobacco control policies related to bidis, increased taxation on tobacco products, and focused advocacy at state level in J & K, and national media advocacy on all emerging issues. To achieve the above main objectives, the project will conduct advocacy-focused secondary research, produce advocacy-focused communication materials and would also use the website for information and knowledge-sharing.

name: Unit for Advocacy and Campaign for Tobacco-Control (ACT) Action Plan
description: To advocate for the amendment of the COPTA 2003 to address loopholes in the act, advocate for it's effective implementation, create strategies to prompt enactment of new state/local tobacco control laws, including smoke-free workplaces, advertising bans, and taxation and support litigation and administrative action to support implementation of tobacco control policies

name: To support the placement of advertisements in prominent Delhi and regional language newspapers supporting pictorial health warnings
description: To implement a paid media campaign in advance of a Group of Ministers meeting to discuss pictorial health warnings, and to highlight the release of the WHOs MPOWER report through press work.

name: PAT & APPLE PROJECT - Partnership Against Tobacco and Action for Policies, Politics, Legislation and Empowerment
description: The project aims to build capacity for and mobilise tobacco control at grassroots level, establish advocacy for tobacco control policy at State level, and set up a tobacco control monitoring and reporting network.

name: VHAI PAT & APPLE PROJECT II -- PARTNERSHIP AGAINST TOBACO AND ACTION FOR POLICIES, POLITICS, LEGISLATION AND EMPOWERMENT
description: The project aims to strengthen and increase existing tobacco control initiatives and expand them to five new states. Areas of focus include building on best practices, promoting coordinated policy advocacy, creating a National Tobacco Control Network, monitoring and reporting, and developing capacity and leadership for tobacco control.

name: VHAI Advocacy and Campaign Unit for Tobacco Control
description: The project intends to be strengthen ongoing advocacy campaigns for effectve implementation of local and national tobacco control policies that will improve health through reduced tobacco use, awareness of the hazards of tobacco use and exposure to second hand smoke.

name: VHAI PAT & APPLE -3 (Partnership against Tobacco and Action for Policies, Politics, Legislations and Empowerment)
description: The project aims to create smoke free public places by strengthening and expanding tobacco control initiatives in five states: Assam, Jammu and Kashmir, Orissa, Rajasthan, and Uttar Pradesh.  It will create smoke free public places within cities and districts; create tobacco free educational institutions by strengthening enforcement of the Cigarettes and Other Tobacco Products Act (COTPA), and improve enforcement, monitoring and compliance of tobacco control laws.

name: VHAI Partnership against Tobacco and Action for Policies, Politics, Legislation and Empowerment Project IV (VHAI PAT & APPLE Project)
description: The aim of phase four of the project is to apply the gains from previous phases to expand advocacy for implementation of COTPA Section 4 and 6 across 2 states and 9 districts.  Key areas are safe-guarding the public from second hand smoke; children and young adults from initiating tobacco use and gaining access to tobacco products.  The project will aim at institutionalizing a strong enforcement mechanism for establishing smoke free public places and tobacco free educational Institutions.  The project will pro-actively support the National Tobacco Control Programme being implemented by the Government.

name: VHAI Advocacy and Campaign Unit for Tobacco-Control
description: The project will focus on seeking high-level policy and political support for tobacco control policies to regulate bidis, increase taxation on tobacco products, and ensure rotation of effective graphic health warnings. It will also be focused on advocating effective implementation and enforcement of COTPA at the state level in Jammu & Kashmir, and continue strong national media advocacy on all emerging issues.

name: High level policy and media advocacy on tobacco control
description: This project will further tobacco control efforts in India by supporting strong pack warnings, GST/tax, COTPA Amendments, comprehensive tobacco control in the state of Jammu & Kashmir, and state level tobacco taxation the in four states of Andhra Pradesh, Delhi, Telangana and Uttar Pradesh.

name: 100% Smoke-free Bali
description: The aim of this project is to implement 100% smoke free law recently passed by the Bali Provincial Legislative Council.

name: Policy Advocacy for Effective Tobacco Tax and Price Measures in Indonesia
org: Demographic Institute; Faculty of Economics; University of Indonesia
description: To influence the policy-makers in Indonesia for undertaking effective tobacco tax and price policy. This will be achieved through relevant advocacy activities and capacity building for raising tobacco taxes to policy-makers and other stakeholders.

name: Building the capacity of public health systems in Indonesia to implement effective tobacco control.
org: Directorate of Non Communicable Disease Control
description: The project aims to train the NCDC team and reinforce their capacity to develop and implement a national tobacco control strategy and to support tobacco control activities in at least seven provinces, focusing on 100% smokefree environments. Provincial steering committees will be established.

name: Building the capacity of public health systems in Indonesia to implement effective tobacco control
org: Directorate of Non Communicable Disease Control
description: The aim of this project is to support national tobacco control policy development, adoption, implementation, monitoring and evaluation by strengthening the health system at the national and sub-national level.  The project will work with stakeholders to support implementation of Health Law 2009 and strengthen health systems and policy through development and dissemination of guidelines on smoke free policy and graphic health warning and labelling.

name: Building the capacity of public health systems in Indonesia to implement effective tobacco control
org: Directorate of Non Communicable Disease Control
description: Country: Indonesia

name: Increasing Cigarette Excise-A Key to Reducing Cigarette Consumption in Indonesia
org: Faculty of Public Health University of Indonesia
description: The Faculty of Public Health University of Indonesia (FPHUI) will focus on reforming and raising Indonesia’s national tobacco excise tax.

name: Endorsing Good Governance on Tobacco Policy in Indonesia
description: To carry out a good governance campaign with anti-tobacco coalition partners that promote transparency and accountability through activities aiming to encourage fundamental changes in government policies related to governance of tobacco. This broad campaign aims to create good governance for the cigarette industry in Indonesia, while reducing the adverse effect of the tobacco industry upon public health.

name: Gaining Political Commitment of the Elected Members of National Parliament (2009-2014) and Advocating for the Enactment of a Comprehensive National Tobacco Control Bill and Accession of FCTC -for Protection of Public Health
org: Indonesian Forum of Parliamentarians on Population and Development
description: The purpose of the project is to gain support from the current elected members of parliament (2009-2014) at the national level for the enactment of the Bill on "Controlling the Impact of Tobacco Products on Health", in compliance with the Framework Convention on Tobacco Control (FCTC). The project will also seek to advocate with Commission I of the government for FCTC accession

name: To gain political support to pass draft bill on mitigating impact of tobacco products on health
org: Indonesian Forum of Parliamentarians on Population and Development (IFPPD)
description: To gain political commitment through tobacco Control policy Advocacy at National  Parliaments to enact the bill on controlling the Impact of tobacco products on Health and FCTC

name: Policy advocacy within the national parliament to gain political commitment of newly elected MPS (2009-2014) to enact the tobacoo control bill and FCTC.
org: Indonesian Forum of Parliamentarians on Population and Development (IFPPD)
description: The purpose of the project is to advocate for inclusion of the Bill that is in compliance with the FCTC with the newly elected members of parliament (2009-2014), and gain a commitment to prioritize it for discussions in the year 2010, and enactment thereafter. The project also seeks to motivate the members of parliament of commission IX to urge Minister of Health to accede FCTC.

name: To mobilize public support on tobacco control and to support FCTC accession
description: The project aims to seek support from interfaith groups to support tobacco control.

name: Promoting public support for Tobacco Control and FCTC accession
description: The aim of this project is to support Indonesia’s accession to the Framework Convention on Tobacco Control (FCTC).  The project will enhance policy advocacy on FCTC accession through development of evidence, policy briefings, engagement and education of strategic stakeholders, and provision of up-to-date information and materials.  The project will also expand and strengthen networks on tobacco control with interfaith, academics, professionals and women leaders.  Key strategies overall include consolidation of lessons learned, strengthening and consolidating partnerships, and promoting evidence-based policy at the highest levels of policy-making.

name: Tobacco Control Support Centre (TCSC), Indonesia
org: Indonesian Public Health Association, Tobacco Control Working Group
description: The project aims to establish a national tobacco control support centre to coordinate tobacco control activities in Indonesia and to lead a policy advocacy campaign for changes to the legislation for Smokefree municipalities and health warnings.

name: Tobacco Control Support Centre of the Indonesian Public Health Association (TCSC-IPHA)
org: Indonesian Public Health Association, Tobacco Control Working Group
description: The project aims to bring about a policy change through a coordinated NGO strategy for tobacco control in Indonesia. It will develop campaigns for the: introduction of graphic health warnings; implementation of a smokefree ordinance in Palembang; initiation of a smokefree ordinance in Pontianak. It will also develop and support the Indonesian Tobacco Control Network, and further develop TCSC as a resource.

name: Leadership in tobacco control and network development to protect Indonesian people from the harmful effects of tobacco
org: Indonesian Public Health Association, Tobacco Control Working Group
description: The project aims to strengthen the tobacco control support centre to be able to provide high level policy assistance and information to support decision makers. The project will educate new champions within the political framework at the highest levels at national and sub-national level. It will also work to establish the inclusion of 100% smokefree laws in Palembang and Pontianak with an aim of more than 90% compliance.

name: Leadership in tobacco control to protect Indonesian people from the harmful effects of tobacco
org: Indonesian Public Health Association, Tobacco Control Working Group
description: The aim of this project is to contribute to the development of a national tobacco control law.  It will support the government in the policy making process of FCTC accession and the subsequent adoption of a comprehensive national tobacco control law.  Towards this end the project will conduct high level policy advocacy on these issues with the government, with emphasis on pictorial health warnings and smoke free policy. It will continue to strengthen the tobacco control network at both national and sub-national level, build and strengthen the evidence-base on tobacco control in Indonesia. The project will also provide technical support for 100% smoke free policy implementation in Pontianak City.

name: Public Interest lawyers for Indonesian Tobacco Control network (PIL-ITCN)
org: Jakarta Resident Forum (Forum Warga Kota Jakarta) FAKTA
description: The main purpose of this project will be to focus on the legal support for the smoke free legislation in priority cities as needed, establishing and building capacity of a network of lawyers to address tobacco control issues, and the formation of a legal network to address tobacco control issues.

name: Legal support for tobacco control in Indonesia
org: Jakarta Resident Forum (Forum Warga Kota Jakarta) FAKTA
description: The main purpose of this project is to provide legal support in the development of various national and subnational tobacco control legislations in Indonesia. FAKTA will also lead tobacco control litigation efforts, both defensive and proactive in order to ensure that current provisions on tobacco control are safeguarded, and that tobacco control goals are furthered in Indonesia.

name: Providing Technical and Legal Assistance on Tobacco Control Policies and Laws to Ensure Best Practices
org: JAKARTA RESIDENT FORUM (FORUM WARGA KOTA JAKARTA) FAKTA
description: FAKTA will provide legal support in the development of various national and subnational tobacco control legislation, build legal expertise in tobacco control policy, and lead defensive and proactive tobacco control litigation efforts.

name: Working to Ban tobacco industry sponsorship in six targeted music and film industries in Indonesia
org: Komisi Nasional Pengendalian Tembakau (National Commission on Tobacco Control - NCTC)
description: To work towards a ban on tobacco industry sponsorship in six music and film industries in Indonesia, identify champions among industry representatives to advocate for tobacco-free entertainment.

name: Strengthening Smoke-Free Areas Regulation (SFA) and its Implementation in Semarang
org: Lembaga Pembinaan dan Perlindungan Konsumen Semarang
description: The purpose of the project will be to advocate for the passage of a city regulation (perdah) that will strengthen implementation of smoke-free areas, and to support establishment and capacity building of institutions that will administer the enforcement.

name: Lembaga Pembinaan Dan Perlindungan Konsumen Semarang
description: Country: Indonesia

name: Advocacy and Implementation of Semarang’s Smoke-Free Perda
org: Lembaga Pembinaan Dan Perlindungan Konsumen Semarang
description: LP2K will assist Semarang City with the implementation and enforcement of a city-wide perda that establishes smoke-free and tobacco advertising, promotion, and sponsorship-free areas.

name: Campaign for the socialisation of the provincial smoke-free law of Bali and advocacy towards formulation of a smoke-free law at the district level
description: The project aims to support implementation of the provincial smoke-free perda in all regions of Bali in an effort to protect children and adolescents from the dangers of exposure to second hand smoke. This will be done through the socialization of the provincial perda and supporting its implementation in areas where the provincial government has the jurisdiction. At the district/municipality level, LPA will launch efforts to pass Perda's initially in three of Bali's districts (Denpasar City, Badung and Jembrana Districs) to ensure effective smoke-free implementation in those districts.

name: Smoke-free implementation in the regencies who have PERDA and development at regencies level who do not have a smoke-free PERDA
description: LPA Bali will advocate for smoke-free and tobacco advertising, promotion, and sponsorship-free areas in select regencies in Bali; at the same time, LPA Bali will assist with implementation of the areas where the legislation has already passed.

name: Advocacy for tobacco ads ban in the Broadcasting Bill

name: Encouraging Parliament and Government Initiatives to Ban Tobacco Advertisement and Promotion as a Proactive Measure for Children Against Addictive Substances
description: Lentera Anak will advocate for FCTC accession, encourage and monitor Parliament and government initiatives to ban tobacco advertisement and promotion, and focus attention and create a dialogue on tobacco advertising, promotion, and sponsorship issues.

name: Encouraging  Government Initiatives to Ban Tobacco Advertisement and Promotion through FCTC accession and Protecting Children Against Addictive Substances
description: Lentera Anak Indonesia will focus on FCTC accession and protecting children from tobacco advertising through the lens of children’s rights

name: Working with Doctors to Promote Public Health through FCTC Accession
description: Medicuss will work with doctors and civil society to advocate for FCTC accession.

name: Strengthen Tobacco Control at National and Sub-National Level in Indonesia
org: Muhammadiyah Tobacco Control Center of the University of Muhammadiyah Yogyakarta (MTCC UMY)
description: The project aims to enhance national policy efforts on FCTC accession, a comprehensive tobacco control law and establishing sub-national tobacco control (smokefree and advertising bans). It will do so by gathering evidence and support to enhance the national capacity in acceding to the FCTC and discrediting tobacco industry interference. The project will also expand sub-national tobacco control in collaboration with Mayor’s and Regent Alliances in Indonesia.

It will do so by gathering evidence and support to enhance the national capacity in acceding to the FCTC and discrediting tobacco industry interference. The project will also expand sub-national tobacco control in collaboration with Mayor’s and Regent Alliances in Indonesia.

name: Towards comprehensive tobacco control policies: Building support for the passage of RPP, RUU and TAPS ban.
description: The purpose of the project is to garner broader support (amongst policy makers, decision makers, opinion leaders and the public) for progressive tobacco control policies primarily aiming at getting the RPP (Regulations of the Health law) enacted, the RUU (Omnibus Tobacco Control Bill) re-listed for prioritized discussion in the Baleg (Legislative Body), and to ensure stronger TAPS laws and its regulation through the amendment of the current Broadcasting Law.

name: Building Public and Political Support for the Enactment of a Comprehensive Tobacco Advertising, Promotion and Sponsorship (TAPS) Ban at the National Level
description: This project in general aims to build support from the public, policy makers and other stakeholders in pushing for a comprehensive TAPS ban policy at the national level. To achieve this objective, this project shall work to (1) heighten the awareness of the public, policy makers and other stakeholders on TAPS ban through  monitoring industry behavior and counteractions, and (2) conduct advocacy efforts geared at supporting policy initiatives related to TAPS ban enactment at the national level.

name: Advocacy to Support Comprehensive Ban on Tobacco Advertising, Promotion and Sponsorship: Protection on the Rights of the Child
description: To have a comprehensive ban on tobacco advertising, promotion and sponsorship by amending relevant articles in the Government Regulation No.19/2003.

description: This project aims to Increase public understanding about the harms of tobacco, and raise support for comprehensive tobacco control policies, specifically passage and implementation of a comprehensive TAPS ban in Indonesia .

name: Towards comprehensive tobacco control policies: Building support for the passage of RPP, RUU and TAPS ban
description: NCTC will advocate for stronger tobacco control policies, with a focus on promoting tobacco control legislation, a comprehensive tobacco advertising, promotion, and sponsorship ban, assisting with current regulatory implementation, and FCTC accession.

name: Towards A Comprehensive Tobacco Control Policy

name: Towards a Stronger Tobacco Advertising, Promotion, and Sponsorship Ban
description: SFA will collaborate with other tobacco control groups (YPMA and Lentera Anak Indonesia) and activists to focus attention and create a dialogue on tobacco advertising, promotion, and sponsorship issues.

name: Enforcement of Smoke-free Area Local Regulation toward a 100% smoke-free Bogor City
description: The project aims to support enforcement of the 100% smoke-free legislation established in May 2010 in Bogor City, West Java. It will accomplish this in close collaboration with the Bogor City Health Office and other key partners through four major strategies. These strategies include continuing enforcement of the smoke-free legislation, strengthening partnerships and linkages with NGO's and others to support the enforcement of the local legislation, building capacity for stakeholders to support law enforcement, and continuing to raise public awareness on the legislation.

name: 100 % Smoke free Bogor City by 2010
description: The project aims to make Bogor City 100% smokefree by 2010 through implementation of existing legislation. Measures will include forming a tobacco control regulatory committee that will monitor and evaluate initiatives. It aims to make public transport 100% smokefree, reduce tobacco promotion and advertising, and develop networks with stakeholders.

name: Stabilization and development of Smoke Free Area Local Regulation in Bogor
description: The aim of this project is to create 100% smoke-free environments in all public places, work places and public transport in Bogor city and district.  The project intends to achieve at least 80% compliance rate with 100% smoke-free policy in all public places, work places and public transport.  It will provide policy support to develop a local regulation to ban tobacco advertisements, promotion and sponsorship.  The project will also strengthen partnerships and networking with local NGOs, civil society, and professional organizations in Bogor City and District.

name: Strengthening the Community Network to Reject Cloves as Indonesia’s Heritage
description: Working in coordination with civil society, RAYA will lead the effort to remove kretek from the Bill on Culture.

name: Smoke-free Initiative;  Healthy Bali Without Tobacco Smoke
org: School of Public Health, Faculty of Medicine, Udayana University
description: The aim of this project is to implement provincial 100% smoke-free regulation in all nine districts of Bali to ensure the greater than 80% compliance in all places.  The project will build enforcement and implementation capacity of governmental, non-governmental and professional organizations at the provincial, district and city levels.  It will establish a strong partnership between government and non-governmental organizations and the media for smoke-free policy implementation.  It will also establish a system for enforcement, monitoring and evaluation in collaboration with the government for the implementation of the smoke-free law.

name: Bali Tobacco Free Initiative
org: School of Public Health, Faculty of Medicine, Udayana University
description: This project aims to create a tobacco-free Bali Province, namely through establishing a complete TAPS ban and 100% smokefree environments in all public and work places. It also aims to regulate the sale of tobacco products. The project will do this by establishing sub-national regulation in all cities and districts of Bali and at the provincial level to ban TAPS. It will also develop smokefree enforcement regulations in each city and district of Bali to ensure higher than 80% compliance rates.

name: Bali Tobacco Free Initiative
org: School of Public Health, Faculty of Medicine, Udayana University
description: This project aims to create a tobacco-free Bali Province, namely through establishing a complete TAPS ban and 100% smokefree environments in all public and work places. It also aims to regulate the sale of tobacco products. The project will do this by establishing sub-national regulation in all cities and districts of Bali and at the provincial level to ban TAPS. It will also develop smokefree enforcement regulations in each city and district of Bali to ensure higher than 80% compliance rates.

name: Tobacco Control movement for youth and adults
org: Statistical, Economic and Social Research and Training Centre for Islamic Countries
description: Country: Indonesia

name: Building the capacity of public health systems in Indonesia to implement effective tobacco control
description: The project aims to achieve a 100% smokefree Jakarta by implementation of existing legislation. Measures to build capacity will include the development of a multi-sector enforcement action plan within two years. A Jakarta Clean Air Act Enforcement Committee will be established, and a monitoring and evaluation system will be developed.

name: Strengthening Implementation and Enforcement of Smoke Free Policy in Jakarta
description: The aim is to have effective implementation of 100% smoke-free policy in the greater Jakarta area. An enforcement plan and procedures will be developed. Its implementation will be supported through capacity building, such as training, inspections, complaint reporting and data management. Mass media, media advocacy and public awareness efforts will increase public awareness of the dangers of second hand smoke dangers and about the policy to complement enforcement activities.

name: Strengthening Smoke Free Legislation and Enforcement in Jakarta, Indonesia
description: The aim of this project is to achieve 80% compliance with the smoke-free regulation and legislation and amended legislations on TAPS ban, allocation of tobacco taxes for health promotion and smoke-free law.  It will strengthen enforcement and implementation of the smoke-free regulation to ensure at least 80% compliance.  It will develop and adopt tobacco control related legislations at the Jakarta province level, which includes 100% smoke-free area, ban of tobacco advertisements, promotion and sponsorship (TAPS), and allocation of tobacco tax and revenue for health awareness and promotion on harmful of tobacco use.

name: Strengthening the existing Kenyan Tobacco Control Act through adoption of a national tobacco control policy and enactment of subsidiary legislation
description: The project aims to strengthen the existing Kenyan Tobacco Control Act through adoption of a national tobacco control policy and enactment of subsidiary legislation.  It will accomplish this by enhancing the capacity of the Tobacco Control Board to provide advice to the Ministry, making recommendations to strengthen the existing legislation, strengthening intersectoral government implementation through the development of a national tobacco control plan in line with FCTC best practice, regionalizing the work of the board and increasing consultation with stakeholders at the regional level.

name: Meeting of Indonesia Tobacco Control Network (NGO) Planning 2009
org: Tobacco Control Support Center - Indonesian Public Health Association (TCSC-IPHA)
description: To convene an NGO planning meeting to develop strategic activities to support tobacco control policy advancement in 2009

name: Enhancing policy issues for advocacy to policy-makers and related agencies
org: University of Indonesia, Demographic Institute, Faculty of Economics
description: To influence the policy-makers in Indonesia to undertake effective tobacco tax and price policy,through policy advocacy and capacity building.

name: Advocacy for and Enforcement of Smoke-Free Area in Jakarta
description: The purpose of the project is to pass a special local regulation of smoke-free areas, while at the same time support the enforcement of the Governor Decree no.88 2010, particularly in two areas: private workplaces and hospitality venues (restaurants/hotels).

name: Strengthening advocacy for the implementation of Smoke Free Area regulation in Jakarta
description: Continued support for Smoke Free implementation of the governors decree and continued support for advocacy towards the enactment of a city regulation for smoke free in Jakarta.

name: Working Towards a Smoke – Free Jakarta
description: YLKI is working towards a smoke-free Jakarta by strengthening implementation of the existing smoke-smoke free decree and at the same time advocating for a smoke-free law (perda).

name: Ensure Passage of Jakarta’s 100% Smoke-Free Bill
description: Alongside other tobacco control advocates, YLKI will advocate for a 100% smoke-free perda (law).

name: Advocacy for and Enforcement of Smoke-Free Areas and Advertisement Ban Policies in Java, Indonesia

name: Controlling the Impacts and Dangers of Tobacco for Children and Youths through the Establishment of Smoke-Free Area Regulation in North Sumatra
description: The project aims to advocate for the passage of a governors decree in North Sumatra to lay the groundwork for the establishment of smoke-free areas in the entire province. The passage of such a decree would instigate and support efforts towards smoke-free environments in the cities of North Sumatra where city level regulations will be pursued.

name: Smoke Free Medan
description: The purpose of the project is to protect children and communities at large from the dangers of second hand smoke exposure in Medan City by supporting enforcement of the PerGub NO. 35/2012 with emphasis on the establishment of 100% smoke free areas. Project also seeks to advocate for a smoke free Perda in order to close the gaps in current regulation.

name: Maximizing Implementation of Medan’s Smoke-Free Areas to Protect People from the Impact of Tobacco Products
description: Yayasan Pusaka Indonesia will focus on smoke-free area implementation in Medan City.

name: Strengthening the Implementation of Medan City's Smoke Free Areas
description: Yayasan Pusaka Indonesia will build capacity for enabling Medan City Government to access the local tobacco surcharge and will advocate for the effective implementation and enforcement of the 100% smoke-free areas under City Ordinance NO. 03/2014.

name: 'Implementing a Picture-Based Health Warning System on Cigarette Packages in the Caribbean'
org: The Heart Foundation of Jamaica ( on behalf of The Jamaica Coalition for Tobacco Control)
description: The project aims to ensure the implementation of rotating picture-based package warnings on tobacco products sold in Caribbean countries, of a minimum size of 50% of the top of each main face of the packaging.

name: Developing and enacting comprehensive tobacco control legislation in Jamaica
org: The Heart Foundation of Jamaica ( on behalf of The Jamaica Coalition for Tobacco Control)
description: The aim of this project is to facilitate the enactment and implementation of comprehensive national tobacco control legislation in Jamaica that is aligned with the Framework Convention for Tobacco Control (FCTC). The project will provide expert technical assistance to the Ministry of Health for development of comprehensive national legislation, educate and inform government officials and relevant Ministries on the need for and benefits of national laws consistent with FCTC guidelines. Additionally, the project will undertake diverse activities to increase civil society engagement and support for adoption and implementation of effective national tobacco control legislation.

name: Ensuring Long-Term Smoke-Free And Graphic Health Warning Monitoring and Enforcement
org: The Heart Foundation of Jamaica ( On Behalf of the Jamaica Coalition for Tobacco Control)
description: This project will support the Ministry of Health (MOH) to galvanize and sustain the implementation of smoke free regulations (SFE) and the graphic health warnings standards (GHW) for cigarette packs in Jamaica.

name: Developing, passing, and implementing comprehensive tobacco control in Jamaica
org: The Heart Foundation of Jamaica (For the Jamaica Coalition for Tobacco Control)
description: The Heart Foundation of Jamaica will advocate for FCTC-compliant tobacco control policies and laws.

name: Introducing a Picture-Based Health Warning System on Cigarette Packages in the Caribbean
org: The Heart Foundation of Jamaica (on behalf of The Jamaica Coalition for Tobacco Control)
description: To advocate for strong Caribbean Community (CARICOM) tobacco packaging standards, including pictorial warnings and the adoption of those warnings in Barbados, Guyana, Jamaica and Trinidad & Tobago through the sensitization of policy makers and civil society.

name: Enforcement of smoke-free policy in Kazakstan
org: Public Fund 'Center of support and the development of public health  in Kazakhstan' (PF)
description: To support the implementation and enforcement of smoke-free policies in Almaty and advocating for an increase of tobacco taxes.

description: Smoke Free Workplaces Project: Advancing implementation of Article 8 of the FCTC, Article 42 of the Constitution Of Kenya and Section 33 of the Tobacco Control Act.

description: To create awareness on the Tobacco Control Act 2007, to monitor its implementation and enforcement and to build the capacity of civil society organisations involved in tobacco control in Kenya through their umbrella body (KETCA) to reduce the burden of death, disease and disability caused by tobacco.

name: Development of regulations, media campaign and defense of a lawsuit
description: To draft regulations under the Tobacco Control Act 2007 for presentation to the Tobacco Control Board, the Minister for Health and the general public at stakeholders forums; and defend the Tobacco Control Act 2007 against legal challenges.

name: Lobbying for passing of Tobacco Control Bill 2007 in Kenya
description: To advocate for passage of the Tobacco Control Act 2007.

name: Establishing a cadre of Journalists (the Journalists Against Tobacco Forum) to secure consistent and positive media coverage of tobacco control in Kenya
description: To develop a network of journalists to cover and report on tobacco control issues in Kenya

name: Reducing tobacco use through increased tobacco taxation in Kenya
description: This project intends to train 1000 people comprising of enforcement personnel from the provincial administration, public health officers, municipal council enforcement officers, police personnel and representatives from civil society organisations within 10 principal towns in the 8 provinces of Kenya (Nairobi, Mombasa, Eldoret, Kisumu, Nakuru, Machakos, Embu, Garissa, Kakamega and Nyeri).

name: Advocacy Campaign to Reduce Tobacco use Through Sustained Increase Tobacco Taxation in Kenya
description: To advocate for a sustained increase of tobacco taxes to reduce tobacco consumption and support the development of adequate mechanisms to combat illicit tobacco trade in Kenya

name: Tax campaign to advocate for sustained increase of tax on tobacco products in Kenya.
description: The overall purpose of this project is to build on achievements and protect gains by  advocating for the strengthening of the policy framework for effective implementation of a sustained increase in tax rates of all tobacco products and curb all illicit trade associated with tobacco products in Kenya.

name: Creating a Model for County Level Implementation of The Kenya Tobacco Control Act 2007
org: Kenya Federation of Self Help Associations
description: To create a model for County level implementation of the Kenya Tobacco control Act 2007 through awareness creation and education of policymakers and the general public on the Tobacco Control Act for effective implementation.

org: KENYA FEDERATION OF SELF HELP ASSOCIATIONS(KEFSHA)
description: To advocate for County-level by-laws to enforce smoke-free and TAPS ban policies in four counties in support of the Kenya Tobacco Control Act implementation at sub-national level.

name: To strengthen the Tobacco Control Act and tobacco control in Kenya

description: To intensify advocacy efforts for the implementation of the Kenya TC Act 2007 through the adoption of strong TC regulations in Kenya

name: Smoke-Free Kosova

name: Promoting tobacco control law enforcement in Kosovo
description: KADC will work with the Government of Kosovo, civil society, and the media to support successful smoke-free implementation and enforcement under Kosovo’s 2013 Tobacco Control Law.

name: Ready, Start, Law!
description: The project aims to ensure that the new national Tobacco Control Law is implemented. It will support stakeholder capacity for implementation by ensuring the Law is signed by the President, that implementation guidelines are developed and quickly disseminated along with information and training. It will facilitate the monitoring of compliance and enforcement. It will raise awareness of the benefits of the Law and work with media to encourage public support .

name: Advocate for Tobacco Control Law to be passed by National Assembly in Lao PDR

description: To strengthen and mobilize Lao Network for tobacco control through provision of knowledge, expertise and resources.

name: SEA Games Initiative (SEAGI)

description: The project aims to ensure that the 2009 Lao-hosted South East Asia Games are smokefree. It will: facilitate public compliance with the tobacco control law at Games venues and related services; raise public awareness of the national tobacco control law and the harmful effects of tobacco use; build awareness and capacity among government and key partners to implement the law.

name: Implementing Comprehensive Tobacco Control law in Lao PDR
org: Ministry of Health, Hygiene and Prevention Department
description: The aim of this project is to establish a Tobacco Control unit within the Ministry of Health and to assure effective implementation of the national tobacco control law.  It will achieve this through strengthening tobacco control structures within the government, supporting revision, passage and implementation of key elements of the law such as tobacco advertising and product sponsorship bans, and graphic health warnings.

name: Implementing the New Tobacco Control Legislation in Lebanon
description: To ensure the effective implementation of key elements of the Lebanese tobacco control law, namely the ban on tobacco advertising, promotion & sponsorship and 100% smoke-free public spaces.

name: Supporting and monitoring effective implementation of tobacco control legislation and promoting tobacco taxation and continually sustain the national program.
description: This project aims to continue support for the implementation and monitoring of the newly passed national tobacco control legislation in collaboration with related Ministries, NGOs, academia and media.  It will increase capacity for implementation and enforcement of the smoke free provisions, coordinate a Ministerial action to enforce the Tobacco Advertising, Promotion and Sponsorship ban, work towards implementation of the 40% health warning and advocate for pictorial health warnings.  It will also work on development and maintenance of a monitoring system for implementation.  The project will work to minimize the influence of tobacco industry interference in opposing the new legislation and its effective implementation.

name: Promote the passage of the drafting TC policies consistent with the FCTC and effective strengthening of the national TC program
description: The project aims to advocate for the enactment and enforcement of national tobacco control legislation consistent with the FCTC. It will focus on amendments relating to health warnings, tobacco advertising and smokefree public places. It also aims to achieve a strong and sustainable tobacco control programme at the MOPH.

name: Legally Challenging the Tobacco Industry & Building Legal Capacity
description: The project aims to increase the tobacco control capacity of Lebanon’s legal community and proactively enforce TAPS ban violations under Lebanon’s Tobacco Control Law 174.

name: Media Advocacy Workshop for the passage of TC legislations regarding Banning smoking in enclosed public places, banning adds and Pictorial health warning

description: The project aims to create a national mass media campaign increasing the public's awareness on the presence of the smoke-free law.

name: Achieving 100% smoke-free publics places and workplaces in Madagascar
description: The aim of this project is to support the adoption of 100% smoke free public places and workplaces in Madagascar.  It will build the capacity of institutions and NGOs to conduct smoke free campaigns and advocating for new regulation implementation for 100% smoke free places.  It will strengthen information and mobilize members of government and decision makers, and increase media attention to the hazards of second hand smoke exposure.  The project intends to ensure application of Article 5.3 (protection of legislation from tobacco industry interference).  It also aims to support regional efforts in Francophone Africa for graphic health warnings by sharing Madagascar’s experience in their adoption.

name: Building capacity to introduce pictorial health warnings on tobacco products in Madagascar
description: This project aims to strengthen the legislation on packaging and labelling of tobacco products, with the inclusion of pictorial health warnings in particular. This will require raising awareness and capacity-building to enact new legislation and utilize advocacy and partnership building. Key strategies include raising awareness of the need for graphic health warnings, developing appropriate images, drafting legal instruments and securing endorsement and validation by relevant ministries/experts and tobacco control NGOs, introduction of graphic warnings and monitoring and evaluation of their impact.

name: Secondhand Smoke Exposure Levels in Youth Venues in Thailand and Malaysia: A Follow-up Study to Evaluate Effectiveness of Smoke-Free Policy
org: National Poison Center, Universiti Sains Malaysia
description: To evaluate the effectiveness of smoke-free air ordinances by comparing the change in the indoor air quality in sample smoke-free venues.

name: Enforcement of the FCTC-compliant smoke free regulations in Mauritius
org: Ministry of Health and Quality of Life
description: The project aims to achieve 100% smokefree environments in Mauritius in accordance with Article 8 of the FCTC and the national legislation of 2008. It will: strengthen the enforcement of smokefree regulations; increase awareness of the regulations and respond to public information needs; mobilise key groups to increase support and facilitate enforcement; monitor and evaluate the impact of smokefree mobilisation

name: Understanding Undue Tobacco Industry Interference in Tobacco Control Policies in Mexico
description: To identify the sources and mechanisms of tobacco industry influence in tobacco control policy and regulation and the strategies that the industry utilizes in its efforts to disrupt tobacco control in Mexico.

name: Tobacco Control and Communication
description: To broaden and strengthen activities to promote key Framework Convention on Tobacco Control (FCTC) policies (e.g., smoke-free spaces, warning labels, taxes, and advertising bans) in 11 cities in Mexico. Reporters within and outside tobacco control will participate in a media workshop, subsequent media advocacy activities, and in the evaluation process of its impact.

name: State-Level Policy Advocacy in Mexico

name: Communication and Advocacy for 100% Smoke-Free Environments in Ten Strategic Mexican States

name: Convening State-Level Civil Society and Private Sector Advocates to Call for a 100% Smoke-Free National Law

name: Communication and Advocacy for 100% Smoke-Free Environments

description: Project to promote and monitor the development of the regulation, effective enforcement and compliance with 100% smokefree policies in Mexico City; to increase public support for 100% smoke-free enclosed public places and workplaces, including bars and restaurants, through public education, mass media, and media advocacy campaigns; and to organize and build a Smoke-Free Mexico City coalition that includes all major allies; and to promote enactment of state and municipal legislation, enforcement and compliance in other jurisdictions in Mexico as they become ready for smokefree legislation.

name: To promote and monitor the development of regulation, effective enforcement and compliance with 100% smokefree policies in Mexico City
org: Fundación InterAmericana del Corazón México A.C. (InterAmerican Heart Foundation Mexico)
description: The goals of this project are to promote strong regulation and surveillance and to strengthen civil society participation on Smoke Free Environments as well as to promote tobacco Tax increases in Mexico. FIC Mexico will achieve these goals through 3 main activities to produce political, social and economic changes resulting in a 100% smoke-free Mexico.

description: To strengthen tobacco control policy in Mexico, via the improvement or preservation of the relevant laws, monitoring and enforcement.

name: To improve tobacco control policies in Mexico, Mexico City and the State of Mexico
org: Fundación Interamericana Del Corazón México A.C. (Interamerican Heart Foundation Mexico)
description: To improve tobacco control policies in Mexico, Mexico City, and the State of Mexico, through: improving the General Law for Tobacco Control;  revising the Law of Special Tax on Production and Services; improving the smoke-free air law in Mexico City; and promoting establishment of 100% smoke-free legislation in the State of Mexico.

name: Improving the institutional design and the implementation of tobacco control policies in Mexico
org: Fundación Interamericana Del Corazón México A.C. (Interamerican Heart Foundation Mexico)
description: FIC Mexico will focus on national-level tobacco control policy, improving Mexico City’s smoke-free implementation, and strengthening and broadening its coalition of partners.

name: Baja California, Mexico: 100% smoke-free state

description: The project aims to amend the state legislation and the corresponding local regulations to enforce the law, and to promote effective enforcement and compliance with the 100% smokefree law in the state of Baja California. This will be done through building strategic networks and alliances to create a favorable climate to amend the state law; obtaining amendments to state legislation and municipal regulations to implement the law; and to promote the effective implementation through stakeholder and public awareness and enforcement activities.

name: Strengthening FCTC Implementation in Mexico
description: The aim of this project is to strengthen federal and state tobacco control laws and policies to conform to the obligations and recommendations of the WHO FCTC.  It will promote support for and facilitate the adoption of strengthened policies to ensure 100% smoke free environments, prohibition of tobacco advertising, promotion and sponsorship.  It will also promote amendments to increase the size of health warnings and an increase in the federal excise tax on tobacco as well as developing a legal case for establishment of taxes by local states.

name: Material development and capacity building for tobacco policy media advocacy in Mexico
description: The project aims to undertake media advocacy to achieve a 100% smoke-free environment, raise tobacco taxes, and achieve a comprehensive ban on tobacco promotion and sponsorship including introduction of FCTC compliant health warnings

name: A mass media campaign to promote smoke-free policies and compliance in Mexico.

name: Assessing and increasing the effectiveness of cigarette pack warnings in Mexico

It will recommend the most effective HWL content to decision makers based on scientific evidence and field experiments.  It will also disseminate information on post-market impact of pictorial HWLs to promote stronger HWL policy.

name: Lobbying for comprehensive tobacco control legislation in Mexico
description: To support lobbying efforts of the Mexican Public health association to lobby the  Mexican Tobacco Legislative System for approval of comprehensive tobacco control legislation in 2007.

name: Tobacco smoke free surveillance reinforcement program in Tabasco State
org: Ministry of Health, Government of State of Tabasco
description: The aim of this project is to strengthen and sustain the operational structure for and the evaluation of surveillance for effective implementation of the smoke free legislation in Tabasco state.  The project will strengthen and increase the human and material resources that allow verification operations in order to carry out a thorough surveillance program of law compliance.  It will develop and run the technical and operational tools and procedures to create information and monitoring systems for the evaluation of the inspections program.  It will also promote and sustain enforcement of the law through follow up inspections and outreach activities to different publics.

name: Smoke-free Cozumel
description: Country: Mexico

name: Waking up the national capacity for tobacco control in Mexico: towards the application of the framework convention
description: The project aims to build and establish the national capacity for tobacco control, through the construction of the National Office for Tobacco Control, a smoke-free coalition and a work group in charge of designing, administrating and monitoring public policies oriented to FCTC.

name: Enhancing implementation of FCTC in Mexico
description: The aim of this project is to enhance compliance with FCTC by strengthening and improving national legislation on tobacco control.  The project will promote amendments to the federal general law for tobacco control law in order to strengthen smoke free environments, packaging and labelling of tobacco products and prohibition of tobacco advertising, promotion and sponsorship of tobacco products. The project will also promote increased tobacco taxes and establish a national monitoring system on the impact of the law on tobacco control.

name: Tobacco Economics Research Activities to Support Tobacco Control in Mexico
description: To provide empiral evidence to support tobacco control policy in Mexico and counter tobacco industry arguments to weaken tobacco control in the country.

name: Defending Nuevo Leon’s Smoke-Free Law
org: PRO SALUD SEXUAL Y REPRODUCTIVA, A.C. (PROSSER)
description: PROSSER will defend Nuevo Leon’s 100% smoke-free law.

name: Nuevo León, México: 100% Smoke-free
org: Secretaría de Salud del Estado de NUevo León
description: The overall purpose of this project is to set up the mechanisms, build the capacity and establish the operational rules for the smoke-free legislation in Nuevo León. Administrative and executive measures will be sought to expand the scope and coverage of this tobacco control policy in the State. This project will allow the related Health Departments to undertake a sustainable program of proper enforcement through designing strategic approaches to maximize compliance and deliver the information and communication campaigns for optimal compliance of the law.

name: Advocating for the Creation of the National Coordinating Council for Tobacco Control and the Development and Passage of National Comprehensive, FCTC-Compliant Legislation
org: Center for Health Policies and Studies in collaboration with the School of Public Health Management
description: To advocate for and support the creation of the National Coordinating Council for Tobacco Control and the development and advocate for the development, passage and effective implementation of national legislation inline with FCTC guidelines.

name: Smoke free Moldova
org: Center for Health Policies and Studies in Collaboration with the School of Public Health Management
description: The project promotes FCTC complaint national level legislation in the Republic of Moldova and advocacy support for effective implementation of this legislation.

name: Strengthening the tobacco control legislative environment in Mongolia
description: The project aims to support passage of FCTC-compliant amendments to the Mongolian Tobacco Control Law, promote comprehensive implementation of pilot smoke-free areas in Ulaanbaatar, and advocate for multi-sectoral mechanisms for tobacco control, including re-establishment of the Health Promotion Fund by the Ministry of Health and Sport to ensure more sustainable tobacco control program in Mongolia.

name: Advocating for FCTC Ratification and Domestication in Mozambique.
description: Project to advocate for ratification of the FCTC by the government of Mozambique and for the adoption of comprehensive, FCTC-compliant legislation.

name: Strengthening the implementation and enforcement of tobacco control policies in Myanmar
org: Public Health Division, Department of Health
description: The aim of this project is to strengthen the implementation and enforcement of the existing tobacco control law in Myanmar.  It also intends to develop necessary new regulations on key tobacco control policies to bring them in line with WHO FCTC provisions and best practices. The project will strengthen the national infrastructure and capacity for tobacco control, address packaging and labelling of tobacco products, protection from exposure to second hand smoke and the setting of appropriate price and tax policies.

name: Enforcement of a 75% Pictorial Health warning in Nepal: mobilization of media and policy makers
description: Country: Nepal

name: Policy and media action to facilitate implementation of 90% Pictorial Health warning in Nepal
description: The overall purpose of the project is to ensure enforcement and implementation of the 90% pictorial health warning regulation by December 2015. It will achieve this by maximizing media uptake of law implementation issues, building political commitment, and countering and disclosing tobacco industry tactics.

name: Strengthening of tobacco-control efforts in Nepal through effective implementation and enforcement of tobacco control policies
org: National Health Education, Information and Communication Center
