description: The aim of this grant is to facilitate implementation of evidence-based tobacco control measures and strategies, with specific focus on effective enforcement and implementation of the Tobacco Product Control and Regulatory Act 2011.  The project will utilize advocacy, social mobilzation and alliance development, strategic use of media, capacity and infrastructure strengthening as well as monitoring and evaluation in support of its objectives.

name: Establishing a National Tobacco Control Program to secure passage of Tobacco Control legislation by the Parliament and its execution by the Government of Nepal in support of its partners
org: National Health Education, Information and Communication Centre, Ministry of Health and Population, Government of Nepal
description: The project aims to achieve parliamentary approval of tobacco control legislation. It will: ratify legislation with support from stakeholders; endorse and enforce Directives by the Council of Ministers to implement the law; establish a tobacco control plan compliant with FCTC, MPOWER and the legislation; form a national tobacco control alliance of key stakeholders; organise mass media public education campaigns.

name: Smoke Free Kathmandu Valley: Towards implementation of 100% Smoke Free environments in the health and hospitality sectors.
description: This project intends to support the Government of Nepal towards effective implementation of smoke-free public places policy of the "Tobacco Products Control and Regulatory Act 2011" in Kathmandu.

name: To strengthen local capacity for the effective implementation of FCTC through district network mobilization, youth empowerment and national advocacy campaign.
org: Resource Centre for Primary Health Care
description: To promote the passage and effective enforcement of tobacco control legislation and policy consistent with the FCTC by launching an advocacy campaign targeting lawmakers, organizing public hearings on tobacco control law; supporting the creation of Youth Watch Groups in 30 districts to facilitate the creation of Tobacco Free Zones; and building the capacity of RECPHEC's civil society network in 30 districts of Nepal to monitor district compliance with FCTC regulations.

name: Nationwide Media Advocacy Campaign for the Implementation of Tobacco Control Law
org: Resource Centre for Primary Health Care
description: To launch a mass media campaign throughout the country mobilizing print and electronic media including community FM stations to pressurize the government and legislatures for the implementation of  Tobacco Control and Regulation Law.

name: Policy Advocacy to implement Tobacco Control and Regulation Law in Nepal through Community Mobilization and Media Campaign.
org: Resource Centre for Primary Health Care
description: To advocate for the effective implementation of Tobacco Control and Regulation Law in Nepal through Community Mobilization and Media Campaign.

name: Promoting and Strengthening Nicaragua’s Smoke-Free and Graphic Health Warning Policies.
org: Faculty Of Medical Sciences- Universidad Católica Redemptoris Mater
description: UNICA will advocate for the implementation of strong graphic warning labels and will work to amend National Law 727, such that the amended law establishes 100% smoke-free areas.

name: Second-hand smoke awareness campaign in Niger
description: To support enforcement of and public compliance with smoke-free laws; to launch media campaigns to increase the support for smokefree public places and workplaces among trade unions, business leaders, local officials, and the media; to launch an education campaign aimed at dispelling myths about the relative harmlessness of second-hand smoke; to build the capacity of civil society organizations to advocate effectively for improved tobacco control, particularly at the local level.

name: Engaging the legislature towards the passage of the National Tobacco Control Bill (NTCB) in Nigeria.
description: Conduct legislative and media advocacy campaigns to support the passage of Nigeria’s National Tobacco Control Bill (NTCB) and mount pressure for Presidential Assent.

name: GATS release and launch event to promote public health and support the passage of the  Nigeria TC bill
description: To support the official launch of the Nigeria Global Adult Tobacco Survey (GATS) release to enhance public, media and political support for the National Tobacco Control Bill.

name: Engaging the legislature towards the passage of FCTC-compliant national tobacco control bill in Nigeria
description: To accelerate legislative efforts and mobilize tobacco control stakeholders’ support for the passage and presidential assent of a FCTC-compliant TC bill in Nigeria.

name: Consolidated Campaign for  Passage  of  FCTC  Implementation Bill
org: Environmental Rights Action / Friends of the Earth, Nigeria and Nigeria Tobacco Control Alliance
description: To support enactment of legislation to comply with the country's FCTC obligations; to provide technical assistance to Parliament in the development of tobacco control legislation; to launch a Media Advocacy campaign to increase awareness of and support for tobacco control issues; and to focus an education campaign targeted towards Nigeria's youth, the fastest growing segment of the population.

name: Intensive Campaign for the Passage of the National Tobacco Control Bill
org: Environmental Rights Action / Friends of the Earth, Nigeria and Nigeria Tobacco Control Alliance
description: To facilitate passage of the National Tobacco Control bill through lobbying and advocacy strategies; to mobilize public support for passage of the National Tobacco Control Bill; to monitor tobacco industry activities.

name: Consolidated Campaign for the Passage of the FCTC Implementation Bill
org: Environmental Rights Action/Friends of the Earth, Nigeria & Nigeria Tobacco Control Alliance
description: To promote the passage of the Nigerian Tobacco Control Law

name: To mobilize high profile support for litigation and other tobacco control activities in Nigeria
org: Environmental Rights Action/Friends of the Earth, Nigeria & Nigeria Tobacco Control Alliance
description: To support the Nigerian Coalition Against Tobacco (CAT) in creating a national tobacco control movement to build decision-maker and public opinion in favor of the litigation against big tobacco

name: Strengthening the Implementation and Enforcement of Ekiti State Law on Prohibition of Smoking in Public Places and Mobilization of Support for the Passage of the National Tobacco Control Bill (NTCB).
description: This project is to strengthen the enforcement and implementation of Ekiti State Law on Prohibition of Smoking in public places and mobilize support for  the passage of the Nigeria Tobacco Control Bill.

name: Advocacy for passage and presidential assent of the national tobacco control bill (NTCB) in Nigeria
description: To advocate for the passage and presidential assent of the Nigeria Tobacco Control Bill

name: Supporting Pacific Island Countries against tobacco industry interference in tobacco control through Strategy, Policy, Advocacy and Networks
org: Secretariat of the Pacific Community - SPC
description: The project aims to increase knowledge, awareness and compliance with FCTC Article 5.3 in the Pacific Island Countries, and also support development of related legislation and administrative procedures ensuring such compliance.

name: Strengthening Tobacco Smoke-free Islamabad Initiative
description: Country: Pakistan

name: Strengthening Tobacco Smoke-free Islamabad
description: The project shall aim to strengthen the efforts made to make Islamabad a Smoke free city and develop standard operating procedures to make this happen. It will coordinate with district administration agencies and all other relevant ministries and departments to ensure implementation.

name: Strengthening Tobacco Control Activities in Khyber Pakhtunkhwa, Pakistan
org: Director General Health Services Directorate, Health Department, Khyber Pakhtunkhwa
description: The project shall support provincial government of Khyber Pakhtoon Khawa (KPK) to step up and take ownership of tobacco control as a major health issue affecting the population.  The project shall work towards formulation of an effective Provincial tobacco control Policy and revise the current national tobacco control laws "Prohibition of Smoking and Protection of Non-Smokers’ Health Ordinance-2002" and "Cigarette (Printing of Warnings) Ordinance 1979" to be more in line with FCTC Articles and components of MPOWER policy strategy while at the same time cater to province specific tobacco control issues.

name: Enhancing Tobacco Control in Pakistan
org: Ministry of Health, Government of Pakistan
description: The aim of the project is to introduce packaging reforms through amendments in the existing national tobacco control legislation and to develop and implement a strategic advocacy campaign to engage stakeholders in creating a demand for the packaging reforms at national level.

name: Strengthening tobacco control in Pakistan
org: Ministry of Health, Government of Pakistan
description: This project aims to strengthen tobacco control efforts in Pakistan.  It will enhance national capacity through infrastructure and staff development, develop a national tobacco control plan and related plan of action to integrate national tobacco control efforts, provide support for policies consistent with FCTC, build capacity for effective implementation and enforcement, raise awareness about tobacco’s negative effects, and monitor implementation and enforcement of tobacco control laws at the federal, provincial and district levels.

name: Reforming Tobacco Control in Pakistan
org: Ministry of Health, Government of Pakistan
description: Country: Pakistan

name: Strengthening Tobacco Control Reforms in Pakistan
org: Ministry of National Health Services, Regulations and Coordination, Government of Pakistan
description: This project aims to strengthen tobacco control regulation relating to pictoral health warnings (PHW) in order to enhance FCTC compliance. It will achieve this through issuing statutory regulation orders (SROs) on the rotation of PHWs, launching PHWs and coordinating with provinces and other stakeholders to ensure and monitor compliance with SROs.

name: Advancing Tobacco Control Reforms in Pakistan
org: Ministry of National Health Services, Regulations and Coordination, Government of Pakistan
description: The purpose of this project is to provide technical assistance to relevant ministries and departments to protect tobacco control policies from tobacco industry influence. It also aims to enhance subnational ownership of tobacco control. It will achieve this by providing technical assistance to the ministries of Health, Finance, Commerce, and other relevant bodies and working with provincial governments to set up provincial Tobacco Control Cells (TCCs).

name: Development and implementation of tobacco control policies project - Pakistan
org: Society for Alternative Media and Research
description: To effectively monitor implementation of laws by strengthening the Coalition for Tobacco Control (CTC-Pak) on national and sub-national level with expansion of membership including new members and areas; capacity building of coalition members through coordination / networking / lobbying trainings; establishing a resource pool on tobacco control issues providing updated and locally evidence based information material; forming a target-oriented journalists group and following up with the activities such as providing technical support to the MoH and lobbying with policy makers.

name: Supporting and monitoring implementation of tobacco control laws by strengthening Civil Society Organizations and supporting government authorities at sub-national levels.
org: Society for Alternative Media and Research
description: To assist with the drafting and enactment of national tobacco control legislation; to provide research and technical assistance on tobacco control to relevant authorities in the Ministry of Health and local governments of Rawalpindi, Islamabad, Northwest Frontier Province, and Sindh for the implementation of existing tobacco control legislation; and to monitor and report violations of the existing ban on smoking in public places in Rawalpindi, Islamabad, Northwest Frontier Province, and Sindh.

name: Tax Raise on Cigarettes in Pakistan
org: Society for Alternative Media and Research
description: The aim of the project is to increase the price of cigarettes through a substantial increase in the tax on cigarettes.  The project will use media to create awareness among policy makers on the efficacy of tobacco taxes as a source of revenue.  It will conduct training and sensitization with journalists in order to encourage news stories and will monitor and compile published material and disseminate to concerned circles.

name: Court Petition (Public Interest Litigation - PIL) for the Application of Tobacco Control Laws in Pakistan on the use of Sheesha (Water Pipe) in Enclosed Public Places at the Punjab Province of Pakistan
org: Society for Alternative Media and Research
description: Application of Tobacco control laws on the use of Sheesha in enclosed public places in Punjab, Pakistan.

name: Monitoring and supporting implementation of tobacco control laws at the federal and provincial levels, and advocating for the inclusion of smoke-less tobacco products within current laws in Pakistan.
org: Society for Alternative Media and Research
description: The project intends to support monitoring, and strengthening enforcement of the existing tobacco control laws in Pakistan by enhancing the capacity of coalition members, and developing liaison with provincial governments. Project also intends to address the alarming use of smoke-less products in Pakistan (specifically in the Sindh and Khyber Pakhtoon Khaa provinces) and advocate for the application of the current law on smokeless tobacco products.

name: Provision of technical and legal support to National Tobacco Control Cell
org: Society for Alternative Media and Research
description: The aim of this project is to continue the technical support in tobacco control policy development and implementation provided to support the government’s National Tobacco Control Cell (TCC).  In light of the devolution from the federal to the provincial level of many policies and institutional frameworks, SAMAR will engage with relevant Ministries and Departments at the federal and provincial levels.  The project will provide technical and legal support to the TCC to set up structures at the Federal level for effective tobacco control policy development.  It will also engage with civil society at the provincial level to assist with adjustment to devolved structures and assure continuity with current implementation efforts.

name: Strengthening implementation and enforcement of existing tobacco control laws at federal and provincial level in Pakistan and addressing policy gaps for better FCTC compliance.
org: Society for Alternative Media and Research
description: The project intends to support the federal and 3 provincial governments implement tobacco control laws effectively by providing concerted technical assistance as well as vigilantly monitoring and countering industry tactics that undermine tobacco control progress. The project further seeks to advocate for closure of gaps in current policies on smokeless tobacco products.

name: Muster support for retention of tobacco control policy development and coordination at the federal level
org: Society for Alternative Media and Research
description: Country: Pakistan

name: Comprehensive strategy for enhanced PHW, TAPS ban and tobacco industry accountability.
org: Society for Alternative Media and Research
description: This project will advocate for the implementation of graphic health warnings, a comprehensive TAPS ban, and regulation of smokeless tobacco in Pakistan through engagement with provincial and federal authorities, media advocacy and legal strategies.

name: Controlling the use of smokeless tobacco products through supporting amendment in policy at national/provincial level, and promoting implementation of tobacco control laws in public and work places in targeted districts of Province of Khyber Pakhtunkhwa.
description: To advocate for the immediate application of existing tobacco control laws on all smoke-less tobacco products through legislative changes at the provincial and national levels, and to work towards de-normalizing smoke-less tobacco use in Khyber Pakhtunkhwa.

name: Controlling the Use of Smokeless Tobacco Products through National and Province-Level Policy Change
description: The purpose of the project is to advocate for the passage of amendments (or issuance of SRO/ other regulations) at the national level that have FCTC-compliant provisions covering smokeless tobacco products, and work towards de-normalizing smoke-less tobacco products.

name: Policy Advocacy for Comprehensive Ban on TAPS in Pakistan
org: The Network for Consumer Protection in Pakistan
description: Advocate for a comprehensive ban on Tobacco Advertising, Promotion and Sponsorship (TAPS) & Point of Sale Advertising (POS) in Pakistan in compliance with Framework Convention on Tobacco Control (FCTC).

name: Policy Advocacy for Comprehensive Ban on TAPS& POS advertising in compliance with FCTC in Pakistan
org: THE NETWORK FOR CONSUMER PROTECTION IN PAKISTAN
description: Country: Pakistan

name: Monitoring of TAPS and point of sale advertising in the selected districts of Pakistan
description: The project aims to develop support for a comprehensive ban on tobacco advertising, promotion and sponsorship (TAPS) in line with Article 13 of the FCTC.  It will establish a monitoring mechanism for TAPS, sensitise professional bodies, consumers and politicians, develop and launch a searchable database on the tobacco industry, and support the MOH’s ongoing enforcement efforts through public awareness and partnerships.

name: Policy Advocacy and Stakeholder Awareness Building for Packaging Reforms to Reduce Demand for Cigarettes in Pakistan
org: TheNetwork for Consumer Protection in Pakistan
description: The aim of the project is to introduce packaging reforms through amendments in the existing national tobacco control legislation and to develop and implement a strategic advocacy campaign to engage stakeholders in creating a demand for the packaging reforms at national level.

name: TI Monitoring of TAPS and Point of Sales Advertising in the Selected Districts of Pakistan
org: TheNetwork for Consumer Protection in Pakistan
description: Monitoring and advocacy for effective implementation of FCTC-compliant local legislation regarding TAPs and Point of sale advertising, and advocacy to address existing gaps in the current law on point of sale advertising in Pakistan.

name: Raising taxes and controlling illicit trade in tobacco products in Paraguay
description: The project aims to help the Ministry of Finance to increase tobacco tax and control illicit trade, by addressing organisational problems in the main tax collection agency SET, and other agencies dealing with tobacco companies. It will: propose tax reforms and short-term adjustments, administrative reform and capacity building at SET; strengthen information systems at SET and other agencies; evaluate track and tracing models, licensing and supply controls; undertake dissemination and lobbying activities.

name: Tax increases and supply chain controls and SFE in Paraguay
description: The aim of this project is reduce tobacco use through tobacco taxation, control of tobacco supply and distribution, and prohibition of smoking in public places.  Libre de Tabaco (LDT) will provide expert advice to support the Secretary of Taxation (SET) and Ministry of Finance (MOF) in developing a tobacco tax legal framework, tax base and rate increase.  LDT will also provide expert support to the government in developing a registry of tobacco firms, and assisting in establishment of a tracking and tracing system.  Finally, LDT's activities under this grant are to increase support for implementation and enforcement of 100% smoke free policies at the municipal level.

name: Advocating for effective tobacco tax, TAPS ban, and smoke-free policies in Peru
org: Comisión Nacional Permanente De Lucha Antitabáquica
description: COLAT will continue to focus on nationwide smoke-free implementation, on TAPS ban advocacy and implementation/monitoring, and on increasing the tobacco tax in Peru.

name: To enact a new legislation on tobacco control as to implement more effective regulations fitted to the latest FCTC recommendations
org: Comisión Nacional Permanente de Lucha Antitabáquica (COLAT)
description: To promote the enactment of the amendments to two articles from Peruvian Bill No. 28705 – General Law for the Prevention and Control of the Risks of Tobacco Consumption in according to FCTC dispositions, regarding 100% tobacco smoke-free environments and Health Warnings in packages and labels of tobacco products.

name: To exert social pressure as a ‘citizen watchdog’ strategy, to counter industry interference and uphold the 100% smoke-free provisions in the Peruvian Constitutional Courts
org: Comisión Nacional Permanente de Lucha Antitabáquica (COLAT)
description: This project aims to exert social pressure as a ‘citizen watchdog’ strategy and to counter industry interference and uphold the 100% smoke-free provisions in the Peruvian Constitutional Courts.

name: To promote the effective implementation of Act 28705 in establishing 100% tobacco smoke-free environments in Peru and advocating for the adoption of comprehensive, nationwide tobacco advertising, promotion and sponsorship.
org: Comisión Nacional Permanente de Lucha Antitabáquica (COLAT)
description: This project aims to promote the effective implementation of Act 28705 in establishing 100% tobacco smoke-free environments in Peru and advocate for the adoption of a comprehensive, nationwide tobacco advertising, promotion and sponsorship ban.

name: Protecting Smoke-Free and Minimum Pack Size laws and regulations in Peru.
org: Comision Nacional Permanente de Lucha Antitabaquica (COLAT)
description: To protect Peru’s legislation providing FCTC-compliant laws and regulations for  smoke-free environments, health warnings and packaging & labelling of tobacco products.

name: Advocacy and implementation of new tobacco pricing policies and taxes, elimination of all forms of TAPS and Smoke-Free Environments
org: Comisión Nacional Permanente De Lucha Antitabáquica (COLAT)
description: COLAT will focus on TAPS ban advocacy, increasing the tobacco tax, and nationwide smoke-free implementation.

name: Advocating for Strong Tobacco Control Policies in Peru: Tobacco Taxes, TAPS ban, and Smoke-Free Environments
org: COMISIÓN NACIONAL PERMANENTE DE LUCHA ANTITABÁQUICA (COLAT)
description: COLAT will focus on TAPS ban advocacy, increasing the tobacco tax, and nationwide smoke-free implementation.

name: Formulation of national preventive policies to face Electronic Nicotine Delivery Systems  (ENDS) in Peru.
description: Country: Peru

name: Enhancing Peruvian tobacco control legislation by expanding ban on TAPS and regulating ENDS as pharmaceutical products.
description: The project aims to strengthen Peruvian tobacco control policy infrastructure by fostering a ban on tobacco advertising in newspapers, magazines, and over the Internet, as well as regulation of electronic nicotine delivery systems (ENDs) as pharmaceutical products and legal protection against secondhand smoke from e-cigarettes.

name: Advocacy to Increase Excise Taxes on Tobacco Products and Lower Tobacco Consumption
description: This project aims to secure the passage of a law that will reform and increase tobacco taxation in the Philippines.

name: Working towards the effective and credible implementation of the tobacco taxation law
description: AER will work towards the effective and credible implementation of the tobacco taxation law.

name: Harnessing tobacco tax reform gains to further increase taxes in the 17th Congress
description: The project aims to prepare the ground for the passage of a law that will further increase the unitary tobacco tax rate in the 17th Congress while ensuring the effective and credible implementation of the existing law.

name: Smoke Free Albay
org: Add+Vantage Community Team Services Inc. (ACTS. Inc)
description: The purpose of the project is twofold: to involve the passage and effective enforcement and implementation of a 100% smoke-free ordinance in six cities and municipalities in the Province of Albay and to achieve a 100% Smoke-Free Albay Province.

name: Smoke-Free Albay
org: ADD+Vantage Community Team Services. Inc. (ACTS. Inc)
description: Smoke-Free Albay’s main objective is to ensure effective implementation and enforcement of 100% smoke-free ordinances (SFOs) in four target local government units in the Province of Albay.

name: Smokefree Manila: Making Cities And Municipalities In Metro Manila 100% Smoke Free
description: The purpose is to achieve a "Smoke free Manila" by establishing 7, 100% Smoke free model urban centers, through media and communication strategies, capacity building for effective implementation and strict enforcement of local ordinances, policy advocacy and strategic partnerships.

name: Race towards a Tobacco Industry (TI) Interference –free civil service
description: The aim of this project is to promote and preserve the integrity of the civil service in light of aggressive tobacco industry interference in all levels of government. Effective enforcement of policies relevant to protection against tobacco industry interference will catalyse the development of and protect the successful implementation of other tobacco control policies.  The project will increase capacity of government staff and policy-makers to ensure implementation of policies on tobacco industry interference.  It will integrate monitoring and implementation of policies on tobacco industry interference in existing programs and monitor compliance with those policies.  The project will promote public awareness of tobacco control issues and build and maintain a strong tobacco control alliance of government and other organizations.

name: Strengthening the FCTC Article 5.3 Implementation in the Philippine Bureaucracy
description: The project aims to scale up the implementation of the Civil Service Commission-Department of Health Joint Memorandum Circular (CSC-DOH JMC) No. 2010-01, a policy protecting the bureaucracy from tobacco industry interference (TII), in accordance with the World Health Organization Framework Convention on Tobacco Control (WHO-FCTC) Article 5.3 Guidelines. By insulating the bureaucracy from any unnecessary interaction with the tobacco industry (TI) and by ensuring transparency and accountability among civil servants when dealing with the industry, it is envisioned that tobacco control measures consistent with the principles of FCTC will thrive and succeed in eventually reducing tobacco consumption and exposure to secondhand smoke.

name: Expanding the Implementation of FCTC Article 5.3 across the Philippine Bureaucracy
description: To implement WHO FCTC Article 5.3 by expanding adoption of CSC-DOH Joint Memorandum Circular (JMC) 2010-01; Strengthen the alliance (national and sub-national) to monitor and address tobacco industry interference.

name: Instituting Implementation Mechanisms to Enforce Advertising Bans in the Country through Key School Districts
description: This project aims to build the capacity of the Department of Education with a focus on advocacy for effective implementation of tobacco control policies, the development of champions for TAPS and eliminating exposure to tobacco within school environments and policy-making.

name: Boosting the implementation of the Philippine National Tobacco Control Strategy (NTCS) 2011-2016 in its selected strategic objectives (Phase 2)
org: Department of Health - National Center for Health Promotion
description: The grant will provide assistance for the expansion of selected key strategic objectives of the National Tobacco Control Strategy 2011-2016 (NTCS). It shall also aim to provide support for the development of NTCS for 2017-2022 based on progress achieved; the drafting of an Omnibus bill for the Implementation of WHO FCTC; and proposing methodology for possible amendments to the provisions of RA 9211 to reduce tobacco industry interference.

name: Moving to the next level in the Philippines – complete implementation of the WHO Framework Convention on Tobacco Control
org: Department of Health National Center for Health Promotion (NCHP)
description: The project aims to achieve full implementation of the WHO FCTC in the Philippines. It will establish a National Tobacco Control Coordinating Office within the DoH and a Sector-Wide Anti-tobacco Council (best practice). It will also deliver a National Tobacco Control Strategy and a Medium Term Plan which aim for the lowest possible tobacco use prevalence and highest level of protection from secondhand smoke.

name: Boosting the Implementation of The Philippines National Tobacco Control Strategy [NTCS] in Selected Action Areas
org: Department of Health National Center for Health Promotion (NCHP)
description: The aim of this project is to support the government to boost the initial implementation of the first National Tobacco Control Strategy (NTCS).  Development of the NTCS was one of the major accomplishments of the previous grant.  This project intends to establish sustainable tobacco control capacity and policy, including a formalized investment plan and permanent core staffing of the National Tobaco Control Coordinating Office (NTCCO).  It will focus on enactment and enforcement of select key NTCS policies compliant with The World Health Organization-Framework Convention on Tobacco Control (WHO-FCTC) such as illicit trade, product regulation, packaging and labeling, and advertising and sponsorship bans.

name: Continuing FCAP's Gains for Effective Tobacco Control Policy Through Intensified Capacity & Alliance Building with Strategic  Communications' Media & Messages
org: Framework Convention on Tobacco Control Alliance Philippines
description: The project aims to achieve national tobacco control management, with priority given to graphic health warnings, tobacco taxation policy, and bans on tobacco advertising, promotion and sponsorship. It aims to intensify FCAP’s capacity in four key areas: (1) increased organizational capacity, leadership and development; (2) stronger alliances and networks; (3) evidence-based policy and practice; (4) communication, marketing and social mobilization.

name: Escalating PACE (Policy Advocacy and Capacity Expansion) with SAFER (Strategic Alliance For Effective Regions) Implementation of FCTC in the Philippines
org: Framework Convention on Tobacco Control Alliance Philippines
description: This project aims to provide for comprehensive management of tobacco control in the Philippines focusing on four key areas:  100% smoke free policy implementation, tobacco advertising, promotion and sponsorship ban, improved tobacco tax policy, and countering tobacco industry interference.  Major approaches will ensure sustainable capacity and leadership, expand strategic alliances for effective regions, and use evidence-based policies and practices.  The project will also increase the use of effective communication, marketing and mobilization strategies and strengthen capacity to counter tobacco industry interferences.

name: A Stronger FCAP For More Effective National Tobacco Control Management
org: Framework Convention on Tobacco Control Alliance, Philippines
description: Purpose of the project is to achieve comprehensive national tobacco control management through capacity building and organizational development, alliance building and development of a Health Promotion Foundation.

name: Countering Tobacco Industry Interference and Tobacco Marketing
org: Framework Convention on Tobacco Control Alliance, Philippines
description: FCAP will spearhead rallies and media events raising awareness of the need to protect government and the public from ProTobEx and tobacco industry interference writ large.

name: To create an impetus for the legislators to act immediately on the graphic health warning bill in Congress by showing public support.
org: Framework Convention on Tobacco Control Alliance, Philippines  - Media
description: To encourage legislators to act in support on the Graphic Health Warning bill in the Philippines Congress by demonstrating public support for graphic health warnings in the national media.

name: To promote nationwide enforcement of the outdoor advertising ban by using media to highlight ad ban enforcement in two pilot cities.
org: Framework Convention on Tobacco Control Alliance, Philippines - Ad Ban
description: To promote nationwide enforcement of the existing outdoor advertising ban by utilizing the media to highlight the need for ad ban enforcement in two pilot cities in the Philippines.

name: Media Advocacy Creating Legislative Support To Promote Passage of Graphic Health Warning Bill
org: Framework Convention on Tobacco Control Alliance, Philippines (FCAP)
description: To create public and support among legislators in both houses of Congress to encourage the passage of a pending comprehensive Graphic Health Warning bill.

name: Advocacy Campaign to Strengthen Capacity of Legislators and Create Legislative Support to Promote Passage of Graphic Health Warning
org: Framework Convention on Tobacco Control Alliance, Philippines (FCAP)
description: To create public and support among legislators in both houses of Congress to encourage the passage of a pending comprehensive Graphic Health Warning bill.

name: FCAP’s Tobacco Control Media Project: “Getting Journalists into Tobacco Control Field”
org: Framework Convention on Tobacco Control Alliance, Philippines (FCAP)
description: To strengthen the link between civil society tobacco control advocates and media.

name: Scaling Up National Tobacco Control Capacity of the Philippines
org: Framework Convention on Tobacco Control Alliance, Philippines (FCAP)
description: The overall purpose of the project is to strengthen national tobacco control capacity of the country to ensure that the Philippines will be able to effectively fulfil its obligations under the WHO-FCTC. It will do so by strengthening the Department of Health, fortifying the tobacco control network of advocates to sustain and enhance gains achieved in tobacco control, and ensuring effective counter-measures of tobacco industry interference.

name: Effective legislation in the Philippines: localization of the Tobacco Regulations Act of 2003 in selected fourmula one (F1) for health pilot sites
org: Health Policy Development and Planning Bureau, Department of Health
description: The aim of this project is to achieve implementation across the Philippines of the (national legisltation) Republic Act 9211 entitled "Tobacco Regulations Act 2003" (RA9211), commencing with effective implementation of an LGU ordinance on RA 9211 in 12 selected provinces.

name: Committee and Policy Development for Tobacco Regulation
description: To provide legal support  for the creation of a national body proposed by the Philippines Department of Health Secretariat that will supervise, oversee, and coordinate activities related to tobacco control. The Project will commence with the legal and technical work necessary for the creation of the Tobacco Regulation and the Tax and Price Measures Committees, as a follow-on to the newly-established Article 5.3 Committee.

name: Enabling Policy and Regulatory Development for Tobacco Control in the Philippines
description: To achieve full implementation of Articles 5.3 and 11 of the FCTC in the Philippines.

name: Advancing Tobacco Control in the Philippines Through Policy Development, Capacity Building and Advocacy
description: The project aims to strengthen FCTC-compliant policy frameworks through advocacy for the amendment of RA 9211, supporting Art 5.3 compliance through technical assistance to Civil Service Commission and Department of Health, and by providing capacity building training to targeted LGUs.

name: Strengthening Tobacco Control Through the Development and Implementation of FCTC-Compliant Policies and Protection Against Tobacco Industry Interference
description: Strengthen tobacco control in the Philippines by advocating for development, implementation and protection of FCTC-compliant policies and providing technical assistance in tobacco control to relevant Commissions and Departments.

name: Litigation Research for Tobacco Control Policy Change
description: To analyze the viability of filing identified tobacco litigation to advance the goals of tobacco control advocacy within the legal system of the Philippines.

name: Sustaining Enforcement of 100% Smokefree Environment Policy in Metropolitan Manila
description: The project shall, using the key lessons learnt, work towards  developing effective strategies for enforcement practices for a smoke free environment. It shall also proactively work towards enforcement sustainability beyond the life of the project. MMDA will work towards supporting and sustaining LGU smoke-free policy initiatives in line with meeting FCTC obligations and implementing national laws on tobacco.

name: Integrated Enforcement of Smoke Free Environment Policy in Metropolitan Manila
description: To strengthen the smokefree environment policy enforcement in Metropolitan Manila by integrating efforts of the MMDA, LGUs and other agencies; provide technical support to develop/amend local ordinances to be WHO FCTC compliant.

name: Enforcement of 100% smokefree environment in Metropolitan Manila
description: The project aims to enforce a 100% smokefree environment policy in Metropolitan Manila. The MMDA- HPSEPO will implement the policy within the agency in year 1 and in 17 local government units (LGUs) by the end of year 2. It will build capacity for enforcement among LGUs; promote MMDA as a model smokefree workplace; use communication strategies and strategic partnerships to support the smokefree policy; undertake research, monitoring and evaluation.

name: Intensified Enforcement of 100% Smokefree Environment Policy in Metropolitan Manila and Other Selected Localities
description: The aim of this project is to sustain and expand upon the smoke free policy enforcement in local government units (LGUs) of metropolitan Manila. It intends to double the number of LGUs with smoke free policy initiatives (beyond the 17 metro Manila LGUs) by expanding the project to selected localities in other areas of the country in collaboration with different leagues of LGUs.  MMDA will provide technical support to local tobacco control councils and health departments to build enforcement capacity, and systems and mechanisms for monitoring compliance with smoke free laws and ordinances, tobacco advertising, promotion and sponsorship and sales to minors.

name: Providing Grassroots Support for FCTC-Compliant Graphic Health Warnings and Support for the Sin Tax Law
org: New Vois Association of the Philippines Inc.
description: New Vois will  advocate for FCTC-compliant graphic health warnings on tobacco products and continue its work supporting the health aims of the sin tax law.

name: Providing Grassroots Support to Promote the Implementation of the GHW Law and to Protect the Gains of the Sin Tax Law
org: New Vois Association of the Philippines, Inc.
description: The overall purpose of the project is to promote the implementation of the two recently enacted landmark laws, namely the GHW law and the Sin tax law.

name: Providing grassroots support to exert pressure on policymakers to enact Tobacco Tax and Graphic Health Warning bills in Congress
org: New Vois Association of the Phils. Inc.
description: This project aims to organize grassroots support for tobacco tax reform by mobilizing CSOs, building capacity of tobacco victims, increasing political will, highlighting the link between higher taxes and protecting the poor, and working with mass media.

name: Greater Teeth and Tools: Enforcing and Implementing the Tobacco Regulation Act
org: University of the Philippines College of Law Development Foundation
description: To build capacity among responsible agencies for better enforcement of existing legislation on smokefree places and bans on tobacco advertising; to strengthen effective enforcement of the smoking and advertising, promotional and sponsorship bans of the TRA in key jurisdictions of the Metro Manila area by evaluating compliance, providing training for key officials (including developing a handbook and networking system that standardizes systems and procedures for tobacco control at all law enforcement levels), and raising awareness.

name: Greater Teeth and Tools: Implementation and Enforcement of the Tobacco Regulation Act R.A. 9211
org: University of the Philippines College of Law Development Foundation
description: To build and enhance the capacity of key city officials and key partners in implementing the tobacco control laws; to raise public awareness of the tobacco control laws and enforcement initiatives through targeted advocacy for Local Government Units; and to strengthen coordination and collaboration among partners in monitoring and enforcing laws on Smoke Free Environments as well as Tobacco Advertising, Promotions, and Sponsorships.

name: Let's refresh our cities.TOB3CIT (Tobacco - Free Cities)
description: The project will implement a Tobacco-Free Cities programme in three large cities: Lodz, Szczecin, Rzeszow, using advocacy, media campaigns and evaluation. It aims to increase public awareness, support the implementation of existing legislation at local level, and introduce stronger local legislation to complement national legislation currently being drafted.

name: Let's refresh our cities.TOB3CIT (Tobacco - Free Cities)
description: This project aims to improve enforcement and increase compliance nation-wide with the provisions of the amended Tobacco Control Act. As the national government coordinator of tobacco control, the Inspectorate will work with partners to strengthen enforcement of the smoke-free law through providing guidance, information and training to responsible officer, with special emphasis on State Sanitary Inspectors.  It will also conduct a media and social campaign to increase awareness of the law and the health consequences of tobacco smoke.

name: Choose Smoke-Free Zones!
description: The nationwide project aims to prepare Polish society for national smokefree legislation to be implemented in 2009. It aims to convince the public of the need for and benefits of a smoking ban through cooperation with partners in government, education and healthcare, and by using national media campaigns.

name: Facilitating FCTC compliance for Poland
description: The aim of this project is to to create effective support for national and local enforcement offices, non-governmental organizations, and advocacy activists in order to strengthen smoke free legislation in Poland and ensure compliance with the highest standards of the Framework Convention on Tobacco Control. Major areas of focus include smoke free policy, pictorial health warnings and monitoring the industry relative to these key policy areas. A variety of strategies, including, but not limited to, opinion polling, community mobilization, media and community advocacy, and policy-focused research and policy-maker briefings will be utilized.

name: Municipal Government Policy Development in Pomorskie Voivodeship as a Complement to National Tobacco Control Legislation
description: Project to support the effective implementation of 100% smoke-free policies in the healthcare and education sectors; and, to encourage the voluntary adoption of 100% smoke-free policies in workplaces and the hospitality industry.

name: Reducing tobacco industry interference for effective implementation of the FCTC in Poland
description: The aim of this project is to increase awareness of political and opinion leaders about the role of the tobacco industry (TI) in preventing effective implementation of the FCTC and thus damaging the health of the Polish people.

name: Toward closing the gap in tobacco control and health burden between Eastern and Western Europe
org: Promotion of Health - Health or Tobacco Foundation
description: The aim of the project is to build on existing networks and develop new partnerships in Central and Eastern European countries (CEE).

name: The Romanian Center for Investigative Journalism (RCIJ) - together with partner organizations in the Balkans and journalists in the region are putting the tobacco industry on the radar through in-depth investigative reports on tobacco issues.
description: To promote enforcement of current smoke-free legislation; advocates for amendments to strengthen current smoke-free legislation; and advoates for the allocation of public funds to tobacco control civil society organizations.

name: FCTC in Romania - Between existing laws and desired policies / Visible and hidden faces of the tobacco world
description: To promote the enactment and enforcement of smokefree laws at the county and national level, advocate for the implementation of other FCTC articles, and promote the use of a portion of tobacco tax revenue for tobacco control.

name: Galvanizing support for the adoption of a FCTC-compliant TC bill in Senegal
description: To conduct an advocacy training workshop to develop a short-term strategy for passing effective tobacco control legislation in Senegal by December 2013

name: Galvanizing support for the adoption of a FCTC-compliant TC bill in Senegal
description: To galvanize support for the adoption of a FCTC-compliant TC bill in Senegal

name: Policy advocacy for effective tobacco tax and regulatory regimes for South Africa
description: The project aims to use evidence-based strategies relating to taxation and legislation and to strengthen the tobacco control movement in South Africa. It will: advocate for progressively increasing tax rates above increases in inflation and income; argue for a national tobacco control plan funded by tobacco taxes; aim for the 2007 and 2008 tobacco control regulations to conform to FCTC.

name: Policy Advocacy for effective tobacco tax and regulatory regimes for South Africa
description: This project aims to persuade and support the South African government to make important reforms to the tobacco taxation regime to make tobacco less affordable, and to ensure that hard-won amendments to comprehensive tobacco control legislation are fully effective as regulations are adopted and implemented.  The project will also strengthen the South African tobacco control movement at a critical period and fully develop the case for sustainable funding for tobacco control through a surcharge to tobacco tax.

name: Policy advocacy for effective tobacco regulatory regimes, including tax policy and a tax surcharge to fund a health promotion foundation in South Africa
description: Country: South Africa

name: Advocacy for effective tobacco regulatory regimes, and a tax surcharge to fund a health promotion foundation in South Africa.
description: Country: South Africa

name: Support the South African government in developing new or revised tobacco control legislation and the establishment of a health promotion foundation.
description: The project aims to support, the South African government to make important reforms to tobacco control legislation. In particular, we will work with the National Department of Health (NDoH) to amend the Tobacco Products Control Act,1993, so as to provide for 100% smokefree indoor public places, to make provision for plain packaging, the regulation of e-cigarettes and to otherwise strengthen the Act. We will also support the NDoH in adopting and implementing effective new regulations once the Act is amended. To ensure the future sustainability of tobacco control the project will motivate for, and support, the establishment of a health promotion foundation funded through a surcharge on tobacco and alcohol. Adherence to WHO FCTC Article 5.3 Guidelines by government and MPs will be promoted to counter tobacco industry interference with tobacco control policies.  South Africa is a model for other African countries and this project will ensure that significant progress continues to be made now and into the future.

name: Tobacco Products Amendment Bill: visit of Dr. Gunilla Bolinder to South Africa
description: To advocate for adoption of strong tobacco control legislation in South Africa

name: Advocacy Workshop for Regional Representatives of CANSA and HSFSA for the lobbying in support of the Tobacco Products Control Amendment Bill
description: To support an advocacy workshop for South African tobacco control advocates lobbying in support of the Tobacco Products Control Amendment Bill

name: Partnering with mass media and government to increase tobacco control law enforcement in Sri Lanka
description: To strengthen existing pack warning legislation and expand existing smokefree places by launching an advocacy campaign targeted towards government officials in order to strengthen government commitment to existing tobacco control legislatio, launching a media campaign targeted towards civil society to raise awareness of FCTC regulations and tobacco control and by building awareness of law enforcement officials on the enforcement of this ban.

name: Advocacy for the adoption and implementation of Graphic Health Warning regulations in Sri Lanka
description: The project advocates for the immediate adoption of the regulation on Pictorial Health Warnings, and calls for Sri Lanka to fully comply with its FCTC obligations.

name: Partnering with mass media, health care professionals, tobacco control advocates and NATA for strong and effective tobacco control policies and law implementation in Sri Lanka.
description: The overall purpose of this project is to increase implementation of existing tobacco control law and policies in Sri Lanka, by working closely with media and government.  Specific focus will be on comprehensive ban on advertising and promotion of tobacco products and on enforcement of existing smoke free laws.

name: Immediate implementation of PHW regulation and monitoring and countering of industry interference
description: The project advocates for the immediate implementation of the regulation on Pictorial Health Warnings

name: Media Advocacy to ensure implementation of GHW on tobacco products
description: The purpose of the project is to conduct sustained media advocacy to ensure the implementation of 60% graphic health warning in tobacco products beginning January 1, 2015. The project also seeks to monitor compliance and use media as vehicle to report on the status of enforcement.

name: Building public and official support for banning  single sticks/kiddy packs, vigilance on PHW implementation AND increase of public and official awareness on key TC issues through media advocacy
description: The purpose of the project is to conduct sustained media advocacy to build public and political support for the banning of single sticks/kiddy pack and for the effective implementation and enhancement of the GHW within Sri Lanka.

name: Consolidating the district tobacco control cells as decentralized implementing and monitoring agents of Sri Lanka’s tobacco control law
org: National Authority on Tobacco and Alcohol (NATA)
description: The aim of the project is to solidify the structural and functional capacity of the National Authority on Tobacco and Alcohol and the District Tobacco Control Cells (DTCCs) in 28 districts.  It will build capacity and knowledge among DTCCs to implement and ensure enforcement of tobacco control laws through training, public and policy-maker awareness, information sharing through the web, strategic partnerships, and media.

name: Strengthen legislations for smokeless tobacco, enforcement of single stick policy, and tobacco tax in Sri Lanka.
org: NATIONAL AUTHORITY ON TOBACCO AND ALCOHOL (NATA)
description: The purpose of the project is to strengthen legislation for smokeless tobacco and to reduce the availability and affordability of tobacco products in Sri Lanka.

name: Strengthening the National Authority on Tobacco and Alcohol (NATA) for intensified implementation of Tobacco Control Act in Sri Lanka
org: National Authority on Tobacco and Alcohol Control (NATA)
description: The purpose of the project is to strengthen NATA to properly implement, enforce and ensure compliance with the statutes for tobacco control focusing on development of regulations/rules of various provisions of the tobacco control act.

name: Development and advocating for passage of comprehensive, FCTC (Framework Convention on Tobacco Control) - Compliant national legislation in Tajikistan
description: This project aims to advocate comprehensive national level FCTC compliant tobacco control polices in Tajikistan.

name: Securing legislation without loopholes; advocacy campaign for smoke-free Dar es Salaam; and national strategy development
description: To advocate for a smokefree Dar es Salaam and for strong national tobacco control legislation; to enhance the capacity of the Tanzania Tobacco Control Forum (TTCF) as a national tobacco control network; to launch an advocacy campaign targeted towards government officials to ensure that existing legislation is FCTC compliant; to strengthen the capacity of Tobacco Products Regulation Committee to enforce existing tobacco control legislation.

name: Towards 100% smoke-free environment
org: Ministry of Public Health, Department of Disease Control
description: The project aims to strengthen the national tobacco control programme with emphasis on the prevention of secondhand smoke through the implementation of 100% tobacco smoke-free environment policy.

name: Countering Tobacco Industry and Strengthen Tobacco Control policy and legislation
org: Smoke Free South East Asia Foundation (SEATCA)
description: To effectively monitor and counter tobacco industry’s new marketing tactics and interferences in the development and implementation of tobacco control policies and legislation, and to strengthen countries’ capacities to adopt strong tobacco control policy and legislation.

name: Countering the tobacco industry and strengthening the implementation of FCTC Art 5.3 and 13
org: Smoke Free South East Asia Foundation (SEATCA)
description: The project aims to strengthen the capacity of seven countries in the ASEAN to effectively counter tobacco industry interference, to de-normalize activities of the tobacco industry and to advance tobacco control policy and legislation.

name: Advancing tobacco control policy and strengthening FCTC implementation in ASEAN countries
org: Smoke Free South East Asia Foundation (SEATCA)
description: The project aims to develop strong tobacco control legislation in ASEAN countries and extend the current media response network. It will: support the implementation of FCTC Article 5.3; advance the implementation of Article 8 (smokefree environments), Article 11 (packaging and labelling), and Article 13 (advertising, promotion and sponsorship) and the national tobacco control laws; conduct a media advocacy programme.

name: Advancing tobacco control policy and strengthening FCTC implementation in ASEAN
org: Smoke Free South East Asia Foundation (SEATCA)
description: The aim of this project is to ensure effective implementation of the Framework Convention on Tobacco Control (FCTC) within ASEAN and to elevate tobacco control within the agenda of the ASEAN.  It will strengthen the capacity of ASEAN focal points on tobacco control; develop ASEAN policy papers on selected topics, provide technical assistance to strengthen national tobacco control laws and implementation.  It will develop regional best practices in Article 11, promote implementation at the national level of plain packaging and prominent graphic health warnings, develop and promote an ASEAN smoke free policy.  The project will also strengthen and expand a media network and coverage to support stronger tobacco control legislation.

name: To strengthen capacity of tobacco control and strategic stakeholders in seven ASEAN countries and to strengthen regional tobacco control activities
description: The project aims to strengthen and expand the SEATCA network, playing a more active role in the region, working effectively with each country providing capacity building opportunities and training.

name: Strengthening the implementation of FCTC Article 13 and de-normalizing the tobacco industry at regional and country level
description: The project aims to strengthen the capacity of seven countries in the ASEAN region to effectively counter tobacco industry interference, and to advance tobacco control policy and legislation, particularly implement Article 13 through a comprehensive ban on tobacco advertising, promotion, and sponsorships including Corporate Social Responsibility.

name: Strengthening the implementation of FCTC Article 5.3, 13 and de-normalizing tobacco industry and its interference at regional and country level
description: The project aims to strengthen national tobacco control laws/regulations consistent with FCTC Article 5.3 and 13 Guidelines, in particular at point of sale, in selected ASEAN countries.

name: WAEMU regional initiative to build strong NCD Alliance and integrate TC and NCDs within health strategies
description: To support the Ministry of Health in the West Africa Economic and Monetary Union (WAEMU) countries (Senegal, Benin, Togo, Burkina Faso, Ivory Coast, Guinea Bissau, Mali and Niger) to build a strong Non-Communicable Diseases (NCDs) Alliance and WAEMU to integrate TC and NCDs into health strategies.

name: To promote the adoption and enactment of a sustainable and strong tobacco control legislation in Togo
org: Alliance Nationale des Consommateurs et de l'Environnement du Togo (ANCE)
description: To promote the adoption and enactment of a sustainable and strong tobacco control legislation in Togo

name: To support the implementation and enforcement of the tobacco control law and its implementing decrees through integrated social media, capacity building for stakeholders  and monitoring of the tobacco industry
org: Alliance Nationale Des Consommateurs Et De L'environnement Du Togo (Ance)
description: To support the enforcement of the TC law in Togo and its implementing decrees through integrated social media, capacity building for stakeholders and monitoring of the tobacco industry.

name: To support full implementation of smoke free law in Togo and advocate for the allocation of national funds to sustain tobacco control efforts
org: Alliance Nationale Des Consommateurs Et De L'environnement Du Togo (ANCE)
description: To support full implementation of smoke free law in Togo and advocate for the allocation of national funds to sustain tobacco control efforts

name: Integrated campaign to strengthen the implementation of the TC law in Togo
org: ALLIANCE NATIONALE DES CONSOMMATEURS ET DE L'ENVIRONNEMENT DU TOGO (ANCE)
description: To promote public health in Togo by deepening smoke-free and TAPS ban implementation in compliance with the national TC law n0. 2010-017 of December 31, 2010 and its five implementing decrees, and advocating for a national budget to sustain tobacco control efforts in Togo

name: To support the development, adoption and enactment of strong regulations under the Togolese Tobacco Control Law N°2010-017 of 31/12/10
org: Alliance Nationale des Consommateurs et de l’Environnement du Togo
description: The project aims to promote the drafting and effective enactment of strong regulations under the Togolese Tobacco Control law.

name: Supporting and Monitoring FCTC and MPOWER Strategies in Turkey
description: The aim of this project is bridge the gap between legislation and implementation by ensuring the adoption and proper implementation of tobacco control policies that fully comply with FCTC and MPOWER strategies and that are firmly based on the tenets of health protection.  The approaches include watchdog and advocacy, public and media relations, and training/awareness activities.  Specifically the project will focus on TAPS ban, Smoke Free legislation.  It will apply these approaches specifically to TAPS ban, Smoke Free, Article 5.3 and to assuring that publicly administered programs and processes are compliant with FCTC and MPOWER.

name: Legal Support for Strengthening and Protecting FCTC Policies and Guidelines in Turkey
description: The aim of this project is to protect existing tobacco control legislation and strengthen regulations and implementation of FCTC policies and guidelines.  The project will provide legal support to the tobacco control community of the country in both the public and NGO sectors.  Specifically the project will provide legal assistance and counsel to tobacco control advocacy efforts, inform and provide legal guidance to public authorities and will confront tobacco industry interference.

name: Promotion of attainment of highest standards of Tobacco Control and Prevention of rebound effects of Tobacco Industry in Turkey
description: Country: Turkey

name: Strengthening regulations and implementation of WHO FCTC strategies in Turkey
description: Country: Turkey

name: Expansion of Smoke Free Public Places and Work Places in Turkey: Effective Enforcementof Smoke Free Legislation at national and regional level
description: The project aims to build the capacity of Turkey's Ministry of Health to strengthen its tobacco control unit and to enforce smoke-free legislation by collaboration with civil society

name: Sustaining and augmenting tobacco control policies at a time of political climate change
description: The purpose of this project is to sustain tobacco control policies already in force and address gaps in regulation, monitoring and enforcement during a time of change in the political climate in Turkey. It will achieve this by working with new MPs and policymakers to generate and enhance a positive opinion about tobacco control policies, providing technical assistance to adopt more effective laws, and counteracting TI interference.

name: Mobilizing the community to adapt and support the smoke-free legislation in Turkey
org: Turkish National Committee on Smoking and Health - represented by Turkish Thoracic Society
description: The project aims to counteract opposition to implementing Turkey’s new smokefree legislation from the media, local administrators and the hospitality industry. Measures will include media campaigns, educational meetings and training of regional opinion leaders. It aims to increase public support for reinforcement and implementation of the law.

name: Supporting and monitoring the implementation of FCTC and MPOWER strategies in Turkey
org: Turkish National Committee on Smoking and Health - represented by Turkish Thoracic Society
description: The project aims to monitor the implementation of the Turkish tobacco control legislation and program.  It will accomplish this through advocacy, watchdog, and capacity building functions.  It will address monitoring, promoting and supporting smoke-free environments, point of sale display restrictions, other tobacco advertisements, promotions and sponsorship bans, pricing, taxation and illict trade, graphic health warnings, and protection from tobacco industry interference in all of these areas.

name: Smoke Free Istanbul
description: To monitor compliance of smoke-free hospitality industry regulations in Istanbul, Turkey in advance of the one-year anniversary of the policy’s implementation.

name: Smoke-free Istanbul Project
description: To minimize exposure to second hand smoke with supporting the enforcement of the Law No. 5227 passed on 2008 March 1st 2008 including regulations about tobacco product risk production in Turkey. The project also aims to develop awareness and public support of the legislation in Istanbul.

name: Developing a national tobacco control policy and comprehensive tobacco control legislation
org: Mental Health and Substance Abuse Program, Ministry of Health - Uganda
description: The aim of this project is to create a regulatory framework that will provide for coordinated tobacco control activities in Uganda.  The project will develop a national tobacco control strategic plan and regulations, prepare the regulations for adoption by Parliament and prepare for the dissemination of the tobacco control policy, strategic plan and regulations.  The project will collaborate with key partners such as the Centre for Tobacco Control in Africa, the Uganda National Tobacco Control Association, WHO, and other governmental and civil society stakeholders in achieving these objectives.

name: Strengthening the implementation of FCTC, the Tobacco Control Policy and Strategic Plan in Uganda
org: Mental Health and Substance Abuse Program, Ministry of Health - Uganda
description: The aim of this project is to increase knowledge and build capacity of relevant sectors, authorities and agencies for successful implementation and enforcement of the tobacco control policy and strategic plan, in line with the FCTC.  The project will disseminate the tobacco control policy, strategic plan and FCTC guidelines.  It will increase knowledge and building capacity of relevant government sectors for the implementation of the FCTC in line with the National Tobacco Control Policy and Strategic Plan.  The project will support adoption of the Bill and Policy and protecting them by continuously monitoring and countering tobacco industry interference.

name: Building and strengthening parliamentary support for passing the Tobacco Control Bill in Uganda
description: To build and strengthen parliamentary support for passing the TC Bill in Uganda and ensure the formulation and effective implementation of relevant policies to enable reduction in the prevalence of Non-Communicable Diseases.

name: To engage the media to advocate for the enactment of the TC bill in Uganda
description: To accelerate the campaign to mobilize media to advocate and support the passage of the TC bill in Uganda

name: "The TC Media Champion"- Engaging the Media  to  Advocate for the Enactment
description: To build capacity of media personnel and advocates on tobacco control-related agenda and issues, and strengthen their skills in media and communications advocacy in support of the adoption of the TC Bill in Uganda.

name: Engaging the media to advocate for the adoption and enforcement of the TC bill in Uganda
description: The purpose of this project is to strengthen and sustain the ongoing media campaign to pass the tobacco control bill, increase public awareness of tobacco control issues through the media, and strengthen the pro- TC push by the alliance of media and TC advocates.

name: Broadening CSOs' voice in passing the Tobacco Control Bill in Uganda
description: To galvanize CSOs in support of the adoption of the national TC Bill and strengthen sustained advocacy for a regulatory framework for controlling production and use of tobacco in Uganda.

name: Strengthening/amplifying CSOs’ voice in the adoption and implementation of the national tobacco  control bill in Uganda
description: The purpose of this grant is to strengthen the voices of CSOs to sustain the advocacy for the adoption and implementation of the TC bill in Uganda and for a regulatory framework to control tobacco use and production.  This second phase of the project builds on the achievements, experiences and lessons drawn from the previous grant.

name: Tobacco Control Resource Center for the Russian speaking countries
description: To create a resource center for organizations in Eastern Europe and Central Asia. ADIC provides information to advocates and tobacco control groups throughout the region through the creation and dissemination of fact sheets, answers to tobacco industry statements and arguments and newsletters.

name: Mobilizing local communities to advocate for the adoption of 100% smoke-free by-laws in selected Ukrainian cities
description: To promote smokefree policies in three regional centers in Ukraine; to strengthen the capacity of civil society to enforce current smokefree by-laws in Cherkasy, Kherson and Lutsk; to launch media campaigns aimed at raising awareness of tobacco control and to launch an advocacy campaign aimed at promoting and implementing smokefree by-laws in Donetsk, Mykolaiv, Vinnitsa, Chernivtsy, Zhitomir, Ternopil, Simpheropol, and Uman.

name: The increase of the rates of the excise tax collection for tobacco products in the state budget 2008.
description: To advocate for an excise tax rate increase in the 2008 national budget.

name: For Smoke-Free Crimea -- healthy and prosperous!
description: To assist tobacco-smoking reducing in Autonomous Republic of the Crimea by capacity building of coalition of governmental and non-governmental organizations “Smoke-free Crimea”, by enforcement of smoke-free environment in public places and forming of a public support for measures on tobacco-control.

name: For Smoke-Free Crimea - Healthy and Prosperous
description: To assist reduction of tobacco use in Crimea by increasing public support for measures on tobacco-control through informational campaigns, creation of a coalition of governmental and non-governmental organizations, and by development and enforcement of the Crimean Republican Program for smoke-free environments in enclosed public places.

name: Smoke-Free Crimea
description: This project aims to ensure effective implementation of the national Smoke-Free (SF) and tobacco advertising, promotion, and sponsorship (TAPS) laws in the Autonomous Republic of the Crimea.

name: Smoke Free Crimea II
description: Ecology and Peace aims to further strengthen implementation of the national smoke-free and tobacco advertising, promotion, and sponsorship laws in the Autonomous Republic of the Crimea.

name: Smoke-Free Donetsk
org: Donetsk Regional Organization of All-Ukrainian Public Organization 'Committee of Voters of Ukraine'
description: "To advocate for the effective enforcement of current national legislation in the city of Donetsk as well as for the passage of a Donetsk city law to extend 100% smokefree coverage to the hospitality industry."

name: Smoke-free and TAPS-free Donetsk
org: Donetsk Regional Organization Of All-Ukrainian Public Organization "Committee Of Voters Of Ukraine"
description: The project will focus on implementation and enforcement of the national tobacco control law at the local level, a law which requires smoke-free cafes, bars, restaurants, workers, and public places and bans tobacco advertising, promotion and sponsorship of tobacco products.

name: Future Without Tobacco
description: To advocate for comprehensive national legislative and regulatory change; and, build Life's institutional sistainability and long-term viability as a national and regional leader in tobacco control advocacy.

name: Tobacco-Free Ukraine:  Strengthening Successes to Save Lives
description: To promote the adoption and effective implementation of FCTC-compliant legislation and work to protect legislative victories.

name: Learning Best Practices from SF Implementation in Turkey
description: Members of the State Inspection of Consumer Rights Protection of Ukraine will visit Turkey in order to learn firsthand best practices in tobacco control, specifically in smoke-free implementation, in order to replicate those best practices in Ukraine.

name: Tobacco Free Ukraine through Sustainable Tobacco Control
description: This project aims to reduce tobacco consumption and decrease the smoking prevalence among Ukrainian population by facilitating strong enforcement of the adopted legislation and by advocating effective tobacco control legislation and regulations that result in decreasing the number tobacco related deaths in the country.

name: Media Literacy Campaign 'Ukraine Free from Tobacco'
description: The overall purpose of the project is to increase the media standards in coverage of tobacco control issues through: expansion of the overall spectrum of the quality journalist publications on tobacco control issues; support of journalists investigating cases of tobacco abuse; encouragement of online public discussion on anti-tobacco issues; and promotion of healthy lifestyles within the media community.

name: Combating tobacco industry media activities and exposing pre-paid articles in Ukrainian media
description: The project aims to strengthen the tobacco control and prevention policies in Ukraine through:

name: TAPS and Smoke-Free Implementation in Odessa
org: Odessa Regional Branch of the Ukrainian Youth NGO "Youth of Democratic Alliance"
description: Democratic Alliance will advocate for effective enforcement of the national smoke-free and TAPS ban laws by monitoring the law’s implementation and by  informing the public in Odessa.

name: Development and implementation of tobacco control policy in Kharkiv
org: Public Organization "Human Rights Association" Free from Manipulation
description: Human Rights Association will monitor and implement existing smoke-free and tobacco advertising, promotion, and sponsorship laws in Kharkiv, and advocate for a local ordinance to strengthen existing smoke-free regulations at the city level.

name: Smoke-Free Kyiv 2012
description: To advocate for the successful implementation of current, national smoke-free legislation; and, advocate for the passage and implementation of a 100% Kyiv city smoke-free law.

name: Implementing Smoke-free and an TAPS Ban in Kyiv
description: To advocate for the successful implementation of current, national smoke-free legislation; and, advocate for the passage and implementation of a 100% Kyiv city smoke-free law.

name: Smoke Free Kyiv
description: This project aims to support and strengthen implementation and enforcement of smoke-free and tobacco advertising ban laws and advocate for policies in compliance with FCTC Article 5.3.

name: Complete TAPS ban and effective enforcement of tobacco control policies in Ukraine
description: This project aims to advocate complete ban on TAPS, promote effective implementation of tobacco control policies, and support strengthening tobacco control policies concerning warning labels and tax measures.

name: 100% Smoke-Free Sumy Oblast: Advocacy and Effective Implementation Measures
description: Project to build upon successful Round 3 grant and consolidate, improve and expand implementation of existing city and national 100% smoke-free legislation.

name: Development and implementation of tobacco control policy in Sumy region
description: To promote reduction of tobacco consumption in the Sumy area by means of enacting tobacco control regulation at a regional level.

name: Developing tobacco control advocacy, enforcement, and monitoring system in Ukraine
org: Ukrainian Institute of Strategic Research, Ministry of Health
description: The aim of this project is to develop capacity for sustainable enforcement and monitoring of the national tobacco control law in Ukraine. Specifically, it will develop guidelines for enforcement of the tobacco advertising ban and for national and local smoke free legislation.  In addition to providing guidance to business owners on how to implement the existing regulations it will develop proposals for strengthening local regulations to improve enforcement. The project will also support establishment of a national monitoring system of tobacco consumption and effectiveness of tobacco control measures. Information gained from the system will result in a National Tobacco Control Monitoring Report.

name: TAPS and Smoke-Free Information and Monitoring Campaign in Zhytomyr Oblast
description: Modern Format will advocate for effective enforcement of the national smoke-free and tobacco TAPS ban laws by monitoring the law’s implementation and by informing the public in Zhytomyr.

name: Defense of tobacco control progress in Uruguay of internal and external threats
org: Centro de Investigación para la Epidemia del Tabaquismo
description: Ciet will continue to push for greater tobacco control compliance, to advocate for strong tobacco control policies wherever key gaps exist, and to monitor the PMI case.

name: Protecting and Further Strengthening  Uruguay´s tobacco control achievements policies
org: Centro De Investigacion Para La Epidemia Del Tabaquismo
description: CIET will further strengthen its 'Alerta Tabaco' network as a way to support, improve, and enforce tobacco control policies.  CIET will also defend existing tobacco control policies and advocate for further strengthening tobacco control policies using sound scientific research.

name: Promoting and defending tobacco control policies in Uruguay.
org: Centro De Investigacion Para La Epidemia Del Tabaquismo
description: CIET Uruguay will focus on tobacco tax and illicit trade, providing support to the Ministry of Health on upcoming TAPS ban implementation, and strengthen Uruguay’s position vis-à-vis the ongoing PMI case.

name: Paving the Way for a Tobacco-Free Uruguay
org: CENTRO DE INVESTIGACION PARA LA EPIDEMIA DEL TABAQUISMO
description: CIET Uruguay will focus on strengthening and sustaining Uruguayan tobacco control laws, policies, and initiatives (i.e. smoke-free implementation, tobacco tax).

name: Uruguay, as the first country to fully implement the 6 MPOWER package strategies
description: To strengthen tobacco control policies in Uruguay to support the country in becoming the first country to fully implement the MPOWER package.

name: Developing a High Quality Research Centre as an NGO strategy for Tobacco Control advocacy in Uruguayand Latin America
org: Fumadores Pasivos Uruguayos (Uruguayan Passive Smokers ) Association (in the name of Research Centre for the Tobacco Epidemic in Uruguay
description: To improve public policies for better containment and decrease of the illegal tobacco trade on the basis of accurate data, better intelligence and expert analysis of the current situation in the MERCOSUR countries (Argentina, Brazil, Paraguay and Uruguay).

name: Enhancing FCTC policies and implementation in Uruguay: a renewed tobacco control program.
org: Ministry of Health Uruguay, Tobacco Control Unit
description: The aim of this project is to enhance implementation of FCTC in Uruguay.

name: Towards a SmokeFree Ha Long city
org: Center for Research and Community Development Services
description: To achieve a smoke free Ha Long by supporting and advocating for smoke free policy in Ha Long, developing and implementing an effective enforcement mechanism, and communicating the hazards of smoking and second hand smoke to Ha Long decision makers, people and tourists.

name: Establish Smoke-free Jurisdiction in Hai Phong City, Vietnam
org: Center for Research and Community Development Services (CDS)
description: To establish and support implementation of 100% smoke free policy in Hai Phong and to use the model of smoke free Hai Phong as evidence and support for strengthening smoke free provisions of a National Law  and effective Decrees in Vietnam.

name: Assisting VINACOSH in comprehensive tobacco control law implementation and enforcement in Hanoi, Hai Phong, Ho Chi Minh City and 8 Fund-supported cities and provinces.
org: Center for Research and Community Development Services (CDS)
